entry.title: SuccessFactors Joule - Performance&Goals Agent Activation
entry.content:
Hi AI and Joule enthusiasts,

I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve been following the release updates and saw the H2 highlights on agentic AI for SuccessFactors.

Joule in SuccessFactors now supports its first agent for Performance and Goals - designed to help managers prepare for employee performance reviews.

For more details on the agent, please see: Performance and Goals Agent

 

If you are looking for the implementation steps you are very welcome to read the rest of the blog because I like to share the steps to get the agent activated and how you can test / trigger the agent.

 

Pre-Requisites for Agent Activation:

- Licenses: AI Units

- Joule for SuccessFactors is activated

 

Recommendation for PM/GM Agent Usage:

To maximize the effectiveness of the Performance and Goals Agent, we strongly recommend enabling one or more of the following modules: Performance Management, Goal Management, and Continuous Performance Management. This allows the agent to access relevant data from direct reports and provide more valuable analyses and actionable insights.

 

Activation Steps:

1. Activate the Agent in SuccessFactors:

  • Login to your SuccessFactors System
  • go to Admin Center  -> AI Services Administration ->  enable the Performance & Goals Agent

The Agent is currently marked as Base AI because we run a promotion phase (planned until Mai 2026). Please check the license model starting in April/Mail.

2. Assign Permissions to Manager: 

  • Login to your SuccessFactors System
  • assign permissions to your relevant permission roles: User Permissions ->  AI Access -> Performance & Goals Agent

The Agent is designed for Managers incl. access to employee details. Employees would not have access to the agents for there self.

3. Refresh CDM contents

  • login to your BTP Global Account
  • select the subaccount where Joule is implemented
  • login to the WorkZone Application assigned to the global account

 

  • Run a content channel refresh

  • after the successful refresh check the content manager -> a new Role should be added

Required activation Steps are done. Now you can wait that your regular jobs (SF - Refresh synchtetic Group Data and IPS - User/Group Synch to WorkZone) runs. If you want to test immediately you can also trigger this 2 jobs.

4. Trigger refresh synthetic group data job in SuccessFactors

  • login to your SuccessFactors System
  • go to Admin Center - > Scheduled Job Manager
  • Search for the refresh synthetic group data job and start the job 
    • If you have more then one job or not the explizite deepLinkActivatonPermission Job make sure you select the job that includes the deepLinkActivatonPermission as object

  • How to check: click on the Job to get the job details. As JobParameter "All" or "Common Data Model Content Deep-Link Access User Group" should be selected

 

 

5. Run IPS Job

After successful update of the Content Channel and a successful run of the SF job you can trigger your IPS Job.

  • login to your Cloud Identity Service System
  • Select Identity Provisioning -> Source System
  • Select the source system that feeds your Joule WorkZone System
  • Go to Jobs and run the Read or Re-Synch Job

6. Check the Group assignment

If all the jobs was successful users with Agent permissions should receive a new group in WorkZone. If you want to check this do the following:

  • login to your BTP Global Account
  • select the subaccount where Joule is implemented
  • login to the WorkZone Application assigned to the global account
  • select Settings -> Identity Provisioning
  • search for the global user id of a relevant manager

 

  • check if the Role is assigned  (the ID 8074 was created in my demo system, please search for your relevant id from step 3)

 

7. Test the agent

  • login to SuccessFactors as a manager
  • open Joule
  • trigger the Agent (the agent collects a lot of data and prepares details for you - be patient it will take a while)

 

Some sample prompts for working with the agent:

  • trigger the agent: Please help me to prepare my performance review meeting with <Employees Name>
  • some ideas you can ask the agent:
    • can you show me some more details on the received feedbacks?  [if continuous feedback is activated and used]
    • can you create a summary of the current existing performance forms?
    • can you summarize the goals and the status of achievement?

 

Have fun with testing.

 

Let us know in the comments what your favorite prompts during the usage are.

entry.title: How far will AI go... and what will it mean for your job?
entry.content:
In April this year, I decided to voluntarily retire early from SAP after 6 years of a very interesting journey. Indeed, I've lived from the inside the infusion of powerful Artificial Intelligence capabilities in SAP Build, for application development and for process automation.

Since then, I've spent 8 months observing the IT industry evolution, particularly around AI. And now, I have very mixed feelings:

‚úîÔ∏è On one hand, I'm impressed how well SAP is positioned on the market and how SAP AI is powerful

‚ùì On the other hand, I'm more and more worried by the impact humanoid robots and AI, from SAP and all vendors, will have on so many jobs everywhere.

So I decided to share my views with you in this blog post.

SAP is amazingly well positioned with Business AI

A month ago I watched SAP TechEd Keynote and also a few sessions, and I have to say that I'm impressed. By the way, in case you missed it, watch the replay of the keynote:

I discovered AI more than 40 years ago, when I was studying to graduate in 1986 as an engineer in computing science, and 10 years ago I was working for Antidot, a french startup involved in knowledge graphs, where I wrote this white paper on Business Knowledge Graphs in 2014.

So, from my humble point of view, putting together SAP ERP + SAP Business Data Cloud + SAP Knowledge Graphs + SAP Business AI with Joule creates a winning combo. It puts SAP in a unique position , better than any competitor, to bring the best of AI to the customers.

And what has been presented and announced at SAP TechEd makes SAP even stronger:

SAP-ABAP-1 is a new model allowing to handle ABAP language: trained on more than 250 million lines of ABAP code, 30 million lines of CDS code, and extensive technical documentation, it is purpose-built to explain and generate modern ABAP code.

SAP-RPT-1 (Relational Pre-trained Transformer Model-1) is a brand new classification and regression model, allowing to better handle structured, tabular business data. It is a paradigm shift in machine learning, introducing a revolutionary approach that eliminates the security-performance trade-off entirely. SAP-RPT-1 achieves state-of-the-art performance and already outperforms regular text-based LLMs through semantic understanding of tabular relationships.

Knowledge Graph in SAP HANA Cloud is an RDF graph built from system catalog, capturing tables, columns, relationships, and annotations. It providesthe semantic layer needed for exploration, AI grounding, and graph-based reasoning. It allows agents to reason about data, to understand entities relationships, and which attributes are relevant. 

A2A and MCP protocols foster Agentic AI by allowing autonomous agents collaboration: SAP is providing out-of-the-box Joule agents and alllowing customers to create custom agents with Agent Builder in Joule Studio. Beyond that, agentic protocols such as A2A - Agent to Agent - and MCP - Model Context Protocol - with SAP Lean IX Agent Hub and Agent Mining in SAP Signavio allow to standardize, deploy and monitor AI agents collaboration.

To dig deeper on these topics, follow the links I've put in the text above, watch the replay of the SAP TechEd sessions and also refer to

  • SAP  Innovation Guide
  • SAP Guide "What is Joule?" 

And to give you something to think about, this video on LinkedIn from SAP shows how far collaboration between an AI and a humanoid robot can go:

What impact will AI have on human employment?

So, we all agree, SAP is doing very well with Business AI for empowering companies to do better and faster. And this is very good for SAP and its entire ecosystem.

But when it comes to employees working in these companies, things could be different. Indeed, some news popping up in mainstream media are a bit worrying. For instance, according to McKinsey & Company, AI can already do almost 60% of all the work:

Their research ‚ÄúAgents, robots, and us: Skill partnerships in the age of AI‚Äù says that the future of work will be basically shaped by partnerships among people, agents, and robots - all powered by AI. The research emphasizes that capturing AI‚Äôs massive potential economic value - about $2.9 trillion by 2023 in the US only! - depends entirely on how organizations will reorganize.

Indeed, be it for business users, for consultants, for developers, AI agents will be everywhere... and they will do a lot of tasks done by human employees today.

And we have already seen this year how big tech firms have "reorganized" to embrace AI benefits: 

  • Amazon - 30,000 layoffs
  • Accenture - 11,000 layoffs
  • Microsoft - 6,000 layoffs
  • HP - 4,000-6000 layoffs

So in total more than 50,000 jobs have been erased in a few months only. And SAP as well is shrinking its workforce: ‚ÄúIn one year, it could be one or sometimes two percent of jobs that are eliminated‚Äù said Christian Klein, and Dominik Asam  added ‚ÄúThere are certain tasks which are automated and for the same volume of output we can afford to have less people". He admits to be "brutal",  comparing this program to routines such as brushing teeth...

We're reading more and more that AI could significantly impact the job market for junior professionals and entry-level positions in many knowledge-based professions, including IT/SAP consultants and JavaScript or ABAP developers.

In France, for example, a quarter of business leaders already report that entry-level positions were reduced or eliminated last year due to the efficiency gains generated by these tools.

But today's and tomorrow's junior professionals will need to learn the ropes to become the senior professionals of the day after tomorrow; otherwise, who will be experienced enough to mentor and lead AI in 2050?

Because, in 2050, if I'm not dead, I'll be 87 years old, so don't count on me. üòâ

Meanwhile, it seems everyone is trying to reassure the public that everything will be fine‚Ä¶ perhaps to prevent tens of millions of workers from becoming upset about the prospect of losing their jobs?

Should not a part of the value created by all the AI software and humanoid robots be used to compentiate this massive loss of jobs?

Today, in many countries, health insurance, unemployment insurance, and pensions are financed by contributions paid by employers and employees on human work. If the number of employees is decreasing, shouldn't social security contributions be levied on the work performed by AI agents and humanoid robots?

Will robots embrace Karl Marx slogan? üôÉ

What do you think? How do you envision the impact AI and robots will have on your job in 3, 5 or 10 years?

Your feedback will be highly appreciated, so feel free to share your own views in the comments!

entry.title: REGISTER NOW: SAP Joule Agents in SAP Signavio Beta Program ‚Äì Be the First to Experience!
entry.content:
AI is transforming how businesses manage processes‚Äîand SAP Signavio is leading the change. The Joule Agents in SAP Signavio Beta Program offers SAP Signavio customers early access to five innovative AI agents designed to enhance efficiency, insight, and decision-making across your core business processes.

This is your opportunity to test these agents with your own processes, data, and system landscape before the official release‚Äîand influence the next generation of process transformation.

Why Join the Beta Program?

  • Early Access: Be among the first to experience Joule Agents in SAP Signavio.
  • Real-World Testing: Validate AI capabilities in your own environment.
  • Influence Development: Provide feedback that shapes the product roadmap.
  • Exclusive Support: Get dedicated resources during the beta phase.

Registration is now open and closes January 31, 2026.

Meet the Five Joule Agents in SAP Signavio

Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll experience in the beta:

1. Dashboard Analyzer Agent 

Turn complex process mining dashboards into clear, actionable insights. This agent interprets event logs and KPIs, detects inefficiencies, and recommends next-best actions‚Äîdelivering natural-language summaries that explain what‚Äôs happening, why it matters, and how to improve.

Key benefits:

  • Focus on decisions, not data interpretation
  • Spot trends and anomalies instantly
  • Prescriptive recommendations for continuous optimization

Business Value:

  • 80% faster access to process mining insights
  • 5% reduction in value erosion from misinterpreted data

2. Process Content Recommender Agent 
Get curated content lists, including process models, KPIs, and accelerators tailored to your query‚Äîwithin seconds. This agent searches thousands of SAP best practices and your own models to deliver prioritized recommendations and actionable guidance.

Key benefits:

  • Eliminate manual content search
  • Reduce information overload
  • Accelerate process improvement with context-aware suggestions

Business Value:

  • 50% reduction in time spent searching for content
  • 5% productivity boost for BPM teams

3. Screen Guide Agent 
Your context-aware assistant for SAP Signavio screens. It explains what each screen does, highlights key data, and guides users through actions‚Äîmaking complex dashboards and models intuitive.

Key benefits:

  • Simplify navigation and interpretation
  • Highlight what matters most
  • Accelerate onboarding and boost productivity

Business Value:

  • 30% faster interpretation of screens
  • 50% lower onboarding and training costs

4. Value Case Creation Agent 

Move from process insights to financially justified business cases‚Äîfast. This agent automatically identifies inefficiencies, suggests improvement initiatives, and estimates monetary impact, creating editable value case drafts for quick validation and collaboration.

Key benefits:

  • Automated value case generation
  • Clear financial impact for any user level
  • Prioritize high-value opportunities confidently

Business Value:

  • 70% faster value case creation
  • 5% reduction in value erosion from delayed action

5. Workspace Administration Agent 

Simplify user onboarding and workspace setup at scale. This agent automates license assignment, role provisioning, and bulk user enrollment‚Äîensuring immediate access and consistent governance.

Key benefits:

  • Instant access for new users
  • Reduced administrative workload
  • Scalable, compliant workspace management

Business Value:

  • 90% reduction in time to grant access rights

How to Access and Activate Agents

Prerequisites:

  • You have met the prerequisites for your product of the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite. For more information, select your product-specific documentation in the Product Documentation section located in the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite page.
  • You already have Joule activated in your workspace. For more information about activating and integrating Joule, see Integration with SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite.
  • Customers who do not yet have Joule can still register but must ensure it is activated in their account by January 2026. Further details will be shared in an upcoming blog.
  • Although registration begins in December 2025, official enablement will start in January 2026.

Getting Access to Agents:

To access agents in SAP Signavio, follow these steps:

1. Register yourself with the Influence Opportunity page. From this page, select Assessment Form and enter your details, including your Customer ID, the agents you wish to enable for your organization, your email address, and more.

Remember: The customers are selected for the beta program by SAP. Once you register for the program, we'll review your application and reach out for next steps, if you're selected.

2. Sign a Test and Evaluation Agreement (TEA).

3. Share your SAP BTP sub-account name, BTP sub-account ID and region so that we can enable the agents in your account.

Note: All SAP products that you want to integrate with Joule have to use the same SAP Cloud Identity services tenant and Global User ID. For more information, see Global User ID in Integration Scenarios.

4. Your SAP Cloud Identity Services (SCI) admin needs to create groups in SCI for the agents. For more information, see Activating Agents for Users.

What‚Äôs Next for Future Roadmap?

Stay informed on SAP Signavio future releases by accessing our roadmap explorer.

Learn more about SAP Joule Agents

Visit this page on SAP website.

Conclusion

The SAP Joule Agents in SAP Signavio Beta Program presents an unparalleled opportunity for beta testers to experience the transformative power of AI-enabled process transformation. By joining the program, you gain early access to five innovative AI agents that promise to enhance efficiency, provide actionable insights, and streamline operations across your business processes. This is your chance to be at the forefront of technological innovation, influencing the development and validation of features tailored to real-world requirements. With limited seats available, don‚Äôt miss out on this exciting journey towards, more agile business operations‚Äîregister now and be a part of shaping the future of process transformation.

entry.title: Prompt Optimization: Unlocking Hidden Power for Enterprise AI Success
entry.content:
Gaps in Prompt Design Derail the User Experience

What happens when gaps in prompt design or user intent recognition turns everyday AI interactions into a dead‚Äëend waste of time?

Have you ever experienced this type of situation?

For example, I recently tried to claim a rebate for a kitchen appliance, but the company‚Äôs AI assistant misinterpreted my request and left me stuck with irrelevant FAQs. The issue was poor prompt design. With proper prompt optimization, the assistant could have recognized my rebate request and guided me to the correct, enabled form. A smarter workflow would have turned a dead end into a faster way to get my rebate money.

What fun!

This experience underscores a critical truth: when prompts fail to capture real‚Äëworld users‚Äô intent, the customer experience collapses.

For business and IT users working with AI, this isn‚Äôt just a consumer inconvenience, it‚Äôs a wake‚Äëup call. Prompt optimization has become a strategic discipline the bridge between user intent and AI execution. It ensures AI systems can interpret nuance, adapt to context, and deliver meaningful results.

Prompt optimization extends this discipline, helping organizations scale reliably across large language models (LLMs) and multiple AI systems so that business goals and IT execution remain aligned.

Whether in customer service troubleshooting, agentic AI-driven enterprise workflows, or customer engagement, the quality of prompts directly determines the quality of the user experience.

In this age of AI agents and assistants, refining prompts is no longer optional; it is essential for building trust, driving efficiency, enabling scalable automation, and achieving successful outcomes.

Reducing AI Project Failures - Understanding Prompt Engineering and Optimization

AI projects don‚Äôt fail because the models are weak, they fail because communication breaks down. When business intent isn‚Äôt translated into clear instructions, even the most advanced systems deliver poor results. Prompt engineering and prompt optimization have emerged as the disciplines that close this gap, turning human goals into AI assistant ready guidance.

Prompt engineering shapes the initial interaction, ensuring AI systems can interpret nuance and context. Prompt optimization builds on that foundation, refining prompts for accuracy, efficiency, and scalability across large language models (LLMs) and multiple AI systems. They enable organizations to move beyond ad hoc experimentation toward reliable, enterprise‚Äëgrade outcomes.

Together, prompt engineering and optimization form the bridge between business and IT: business teams articulate goals and context, while IT ensures technical precision and scalability. When aligned, they transform user intent into reliable AI execution.

According to a RAND report, 80% of AI project failures stem from poor human to AI communication. Misunderstandings between business and IT teams about goals, data, and capabilities are the most common cause of failure. Companies that master prompt engineering achieve significantly higher ROI compared to those relying on basic or ad hoc prompting (1).

In short: success doesn‚Äôt come from the technology alone; it comes from how we communicate with it.

Why It Matters

Prompt engineering, with prompt optimization as a key subset, is no longer a fringe skill. It is becoming a critical organizational capability embedded into everyday business functions.

According to Market Research Future (MRFR), the prompt engineering [which includes prompt optimization] market was valued at $2.195 billion in 2024 and is projected to grow to $32.78 billion by 2035, with a staggering 27.86% CAGR (2).

SAP Prompt Optimization Adoption

Prompt optimization transforms vague queries into precise instructions, guiding AI toward accurate, consistent, and actionable outputs. With AI agents and assistants like SAP‚Äôs Joule, Microsoft Copilot, Google Gemini, and OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT, organizations recognize that prompt optimization is essential to maximize AI‚Äôs potential and align outcomes with business goals.

SAP has embedded prompt optimization into Joule, powered by the Generative AI Hub in SAP AI Core and Launchpad (part of the SAP Business Technology Platform) and supported by SAP‚Äôs AI Foundation, delivering enterprise‚Äëgrade accuracy and trust with Large Language Models (LLMs).

At SAP Sapphire 2025, SAP announced a proprietary Prompt Optimizer built with the company, Not Diamond. This optimizer enables enterprises to migrate and adapt prompts across multiple LLMs, supporting consistency, accelerating adoption, and improving the user experience across diverse AI systems (3).

Not Diamond envisions ‚Äúa multi‚Äëmodel AI future, with thousands of foundation models, millions of fine‚Äëtuned variants, and billions of custom inference engines running on top of them.‚Äù Their infrastructure routes, governs, and scales prompts across these systems, ensuring flexibility and trust.

This partnership confirms prompt optimization as an important, core enterprise requirement, bridging business strategy with technology capabilities for responsible AI.

From Hard‚ÄëCoded Prompts to Agentic AI Orchestration

Currently, there is a larger shift from static prompt engineering toward dynamic, context‚Äëaware orchestration. Agentic AI is evolving as the inevitable evolution.

In this rebate example handling with prompt optimization means hard‚Äëcoding keywords such as ‚Äúrebate‚Äù and product numbers and writing scripts to manually enable the routing to the appropriate form. It requires constant upkeep.

In the future, agentic AI changes the flow entirely. Instead of static prompts, the agent recognizes, in the rebate example, the intent dynamically, queries the product database directly, and routes requests to backend systems without manual intervention.

Responses adapt in real time, errors trigger self-correction cycles, and product updates sync automatically with the catalog.

This rebate scenario shows the shift from today‚Äôs manual prompt engineering to tomorrow‚Äôs agentic orchestration moving from scripted rules to adaptive intelligence.

Best of Prompt Optimization Capabilities

Prompt optimization is the discipline that converts AI potential into measurable business outcomes, delivering benefits such as:

  1. Clarifies Intent ‚Äì Ensures AI understands user goals, reducing miscommunication and aligning outputs with business needs.
  2. Customer Engagement & Personalization ‚Äì Crafts prompts that drive tailored chatbot interactions, outreach, and recommendations, fostering loyalty and satisfaction.
  3. Structures Outputs ‚Äì Guides AI to deliver usable formats (tables, lists, reports, narratives) for clarity and consistency.
  4. Improves Efficiency & Operational Automation ‚Äì Minimizes unnecessary token usage, accelerates turnaround, and empowers agentic AI to automate repetitive workflows such as reporting, summarization, and FAQ handling.
  5. Adds Domain Context ‚Äì Embeds industry‚Äëspecific language, governance and compliance rules, approved product names, synonyms, and brand tone for relevance.
  6. Supports Scalability Across Teams ‚Äì Builds reusable prompt libraries and frameworks that allow consistent enterprise‚Äëwide adoption without reinventing workflows.
  7. Content Quality & Consistency ‚Äì Ensures outputs are brand‚Äëaligned, accurate, and emotionally resonant across all channels.
  8. Optimizes Across Models ‚Äì With tools like Not Diamond‚Äôs Prompt Optimizer, prompts can be migrated and adapted across Copilot, Gemini, ChatGPT, Joule, and other LLMs.
  9. Enhanced Accuracy & Decision‚ÄëMaking ‚Äì Produces precise, consistent outputs and extracts actionable intelligence quickly to support better business decisions.

By uniting these capabilities, prompt optimization becomes the foundation for trustworthy, scalable, and business‚Äëaligned AI success.

Short on Time? Who Manages Prompt Engineering

The shift from prompt engineering to agentic AI isn‚Äôt just the domain of IT or developers. It is opening up a wave of business‚Äëfriendly, low‚Äëcode/no‚Äëcode opportunities.

Consultants, contractors, and employees can create value by helping organizations design, deploy, and optimize AI workflows without deep computer science level programming.

Examples include:

  • Prompt Engineer (Business‚Äëoriented) ‚Äì Designs and optimizes prompts for customer service, marketing, and enterprise workflows.
  • Agentic AI Workflow Designer ‚Äì Uses low‚Äëcode tools to connect AI agents with backend systems, automating rebate claims, reporting, and customer engagement without heavy coding.
  • AI Solutions Consultant ‚Äì Advises companies on integrating agentic AI into existing processes, bridging IT and business teams.
  • No‚ÄëCode AI Developer ‚Äì Builds AI‚Äëpowered applications using drag‚Äëand‚Äëdrop platforms and reusable prompt libraries.
  • AI Product Owner / Business Analyst ‚Äì Guides adoption by mapping workflows, defining requirements, and ensuring AI agents align with business goals.
  • AI Governance & Compliance Specialist ‚Äì Establishes rules for prompt libraries, agentic workflows, and data handling.

In fast‚Äëpaced, short‚Äëhanded work environments, these specialists provide focus and discipline, coach key stakeholders with standard operating procedures (SOPs), monitor performance, and refine prompts as business needs evolve ensuring AI systems remain accurate, consistent, and trusted across the enterprise.

Final Thoughts

Prompt optimization and its refinement through prompt optimization evolving into agentic AI is no longer a niche skill or technical curiosity; it has become a core business capability that drives efficiency, compliance, and innovation.

Organizations that embrace it gain a competitive edge, while those that neglect it risk wasted investments and inconsistent results.

By embedding prompt optimization as a business standard, integrated into workflows through enterprise‚Äëwide libraries, governance, and automated refinement, companies can optimize AI strategies to keep pace with evolving models, regulations, and customer expectations.

The future of enterprise AI will not be defined by those who merely explore prompts and agentic AI, but by those who master prompt optimization and agentic AI, transforming raw model potential into trusted, scalable business value.

And as a result, users who want to get their rebates processed can save time by getting answers versus gaps and dead ends.

---
Your Comments are Appreciated!

‚û°Ô∏è.Interested to hear your experiences when prompting works and doesn't work from a business and IT perspective!!! 
If you are new to prompt engineering, what are your impressions as a result of reading this blog?
Please take a moment to post them below... 
Thanks!!!

---

About the Author

Rich Blumberg is a long time SAP Community member and contributor. For 20+ years he's been an SAP consultant working with SAP ecosystem organizations around the globe. He's the President of World Sales Solutions, LLC, (WSS) a business development and low-code no-code services company. He has published two acclaimed Amazon books, Job Seeking Warriors ‚Äì A Mentors Guide to Winning and Novi‚Äôs Journey to the Magic Garden. In his spare time, he is a Drexel University Alumni Board of Governors Emeritus volunteer, ENGin English tutor for Ukrainian citizens, and an aspiring guitar player.

---

Footnotes

  1. RAND Corporation, ‚ÄúThe Root Causes of Failure for Artificial Intelligence Projects and How They Can Succeed: Avoiding the Anti‚ÄëPatterns of AI,‚Äù (August 2024)
  2. Market Research Future, ‚ÄúPrompt Engineering Market Size, Share, Trends, Analysis 2035.‚Äù Published (October 2025)
  3. Press Release, ‚ÄúNot Diamond Launches Prompt Adaptation, an Agentic System for Multi-Model Enterprise AI‚Äù (May 2025)

entry.title: Explore SAP Business AI Innovations on SAP Roadmap Explorer Today
entry.content:
At SAP, we are committed to embedding AI capabilities directly into our core applications and processes with SAP Business AI, designed to deliver tangible, real-world business outcomes across the enterprise.  

Navigating this dynamic landscape is key: understanding what‚Äôs coming next, when features or agents are available, and how they could improve end-to-end business processes. 

That‚Äôs why we are thrilled to announce a new and dedicated roadmap experience for SAP Business AI on the SAP Roadmap Explorer website available today. 

This new experience encompasses: 

  • A new banner on the SAP Roadmap Explorer home page 
  • A new ‚ÄòStrategic Topics‚Äô menu where SAP Business AI is featured 
  • A new business view page for SAP Business AI that offers the transparency you need into SAP‚Äôs AI product strategy, development priorities, and upcoming innovations.  

Let's focus on the new business view page, which is a perfect asset to move from high-level announcements to access granular details about specific AI features and agents and their anticipated release timelines. 

This allows you to deep dive into the different road map priorities per Line of Business (LoB), such as Spend Management or Human Capital Management, giving you deeper insights to make informed, timely decisions that drive tangible business outcomes.  
You can rapidly evaluate SAP‚Äôs AI offerings against your unique business requirements, thereby accelerating your innovation cycles.  

The roadmap acts as a living document, reducing the risk of making uninformed decisions based on outdated or incomplete information.  

You can also leverage the latest ‚Äònotification‚Äô feature available on SAP Roadmap Explorer by clicking on the ‚Äòsubscribe‚Äô button on the right-hand side of the page to get notified as soon as it‚Äôs updated by SAP. 

By providing transparency and ability to deep dive into LoB-specific innovations across time, it empowers everyone to confidently embark on their AI journey, maximize investments, and harness the transformative power of SAP Business AI.  

We encourage all SAP Community members, customers, and partners to regularly visit roadmap.sap.com and explore the future of SAP Business AI.

entry.title: Setting Up Joule Studio for All Partner Flows and Entitlement Levels
entry.content:
This blog was authored by Joule Studio Product Managers: Charan Ravikumar and Maria Kondratyeva

 

Setting Up Joule Studio for All Partner Flows and Entitlement Levels

Joule Studio, the latest capability in SAP Build, empowers developers to extend SAP's AI copilot with custom Joule skills and powerful Joule agents tailored to your unique business needs. These capabilities extend Joule, orchestrate complex cross-functional workflows, and unlock new levels of enterprise efficiency.

However, we recognize that the partner landscape, with its mix of TDD, PAYG, and subscription accounts, introduces unique complexities. Many of you have asked the essential question: "How do we, as partners, get Joule Studio set up correctly in our environments?"

This guide is built specifically for you. It synthesizes insights from our support channels and direct partner feedback to address your most common challenges, such as multi-global account integrations and navigating the new SAP Build licensing in TDD environments. Whether you're starting fresh or integrating existing services, this post outlines everything you need to know to get started efficiently and cost-effectively.

Let's get started!

Critical Prerequisites: Licensing & Plans

Before diving into the setup flows, let's clarify three critical concepts that are often sources of confusion for partners. Getting these right from the start will save you significant time and effort.

The "New" SAP Build Plan (build-default)

Many partners have existing SAP Build entitlements on a legacy "standard" plan. To use Joule Studio, you must use the build-default plan, specifically for SAP Build Process Automation.

  • Critical Action: Do NOT order a new, separate SAP Build subscription! In your existing Partner TDD Global Account (under a PAYG model), the entitlement for the new plan is already available.
    • You simply need to navigate to the Service Marketplace in your BTP cockpit and activate the SAP Build Process Automation service, ensuring you select the build-default plan during setup.
  • Note: Ordering a new subscription instead of activating the existing entitlement often leads to selecting the wrong plan and creates unnecessary account complexity.
  • TDD Licensing Options:
    • License the Pay-As-You-Go for SAP BTP for cloud test, demo, and development (SKU 8009282). This grants you access to free "Fair Use Limits" for SAP Build (Recommended)
    • Alternative (Subscription): A subscription-based SAP Build TDD developer license (SKU 8019951) is also available, but it does not include the Fair Use Limits.
  • What is Fair Use Limits (FUL): The Fair Use Limit where the partner is provided an entitled specified threshold amount of TDD services free of charge per billing cycle. It‚Äôs designed to support development without unexpected costs.
    • Please refer to this link for more details on FUL - https://partneredge.sap.com/en/library/assets/products/tech_plat/dgl/30/23/SAP1223023.html

  Joule Entitlement 

    • TDD Joule Base SKU: 8020592
    • Joule for Consultant and Joule for Developers are different licenses and not connected with Joule Studio license and its activation.

  • For Custom Joule Skills: There is no additional cost for the orchestration and invocation of custom Joule Skills using the current features in Joule Studio. This means you do not need AI Units to run custom Joule Skills in your production environments.

  • For Custom Joule Agents: Following the promotion throughout January 2026, the execution of custom Joule Agents in production will consume AI Units.

  • It‚Äôs important to note that for both custom skills and agents, the underlying components they use will still follow their standard commercial models. For example, if your custom Joule skill or agent kicks off a business process automation, the usage of SAP Build Process Automation will still be billed according to its pricing structure.

The Multi-Global Account Scenario

It is very common for partners to have their Joule entitlement in a TDD subscription based global account and their SAP Build entitlement in a separate TDD PAYG global account. This is a supported scenario.

  • The Golden Thread: The key to making this work is to ensure that both global accounts are federated under the same SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS). This single identity provider is what allows the two systems to trust each other and integrate seamlessly.
  • To run Joule Booster or Joule Formation (see table below), select the 2 global accounts you have.

Understanding Your Integration Flow: Starting Points and Required Steps

This table outlines the five primary scenarios for integrating SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA in the future text) capabilities into the Joule Studio environment.  Identify which flow best matches your current setup, whether you‚Äôre starting fresh or have existing SBPA or Joule subscriptions. This will immediately provide you with the exact action steps and critical notes required for a successful connection.

 

Starting Point

Key Action Steps

The partner is setting up both Joule and SBPA from scratch. 

  • Check the Prerequisites mentioned above. Verify the assignments.
  • Setup SBPA.  
    Setup SBPA Step by Step Video Guide
  • Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  • Connect Joule and SBPA by running the Joule Booster 
    Step by Step Video Guide for Joule Studio Activation SAP BTP
  • Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  • Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    • joule_extensibility
    • end_user 
  • Finalize trust/security configurations.
  • Verify entitlement/instance setup. 
  • Access Joule Studio.

The partner already has Joule (Booster provisioned) and now links the existing SBPA (it must be a build-default plan) for Joule Studio.

  1. Verify SBPA Prerequisites: Ensure SBPA entitlement is on the build-default plan (standard plan is not compatible).
  2. Setup SBPA.  
    Setup SBPA Step by Step Video Guide
  3. Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  4. Update Formation in Joule Global Account:
    1. Navigate to System Landscape -> Formations. 
    2. Select the existing Integration with Joule formation.
    3. Click Include Systems and select the SBPA subaccount.
    4. Check Enable Capability Deployment and finalize. 
  5. Wait for Formation Status to become Ready. 
  6. Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  7. Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    1. joule_extensibility
    2. end_user 

The partner has an existing SBPA (on the correct build-default plan) and now wants to add Joule.

  • Check the Prerequisites mentioned above for Joule. Verify the assignments.
  • Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  • Connect the new Joule to the existing SBPA by running the Joule Booster 
    Step by Step Video Guide for Joule Studio Activation SAP BTP
  • Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  • Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    • joule_extensibility
    • end_user 
  • Finalize trust/security configurations.
  • Verify entitlement/instance setup. 
  • Access Joule Studio.

The partner already has both services (on the correct plan); they just need to be linked for Joule Studio.

  • Check the Prerequisites mentioned above. Verify the assignments.
  • Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  • Update Formation in Joule Global Account:
    • Navigate to System Landscape -> Formations. 
    • Select the existing Integration with Joule formation.
    • Click Include Systems and select the SBPA subaccount.
    • Check Enable Capability Deployment and finalize. 
  • Wait for Formation Status to become Ready. 
  • Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  • Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    • joule_extensibility
    • end_user 

The partner has both, but SBPA is on the standard plan (requires an upgrade).

  • Upgrade SBPA to the correct plan (build-default).
  • Both Joule and SBPA need to be on the same Cloud Identity Service. 
  • Update Formation in Joule Global Account:
    • Navigate to System Landscape -> Formations. 
    • Select the existing Integration with Joule formation.
    • Click Include Systems and select the SBPA subaccount.
    • Check Enable Capability Deployment and finalize. 
  • Wait for Formation Status to become Ready. 
  • Verify SBPA Role Collections. (On SBPA Sub Account) 
  • Create Joule Role Collections. (On Joule Sub Account) 
    • joule_extensibility
    • end_user 

How to Activate the Limited-Time Offer for Agent Builder

Once you have the prerequisites in place, you can take advantage of our promotional offer to explore the full potential of custom Joule agents. Here's how:

  1. Build Your Agent: The capability to build Joule agents will automatically appear in your lobby‚Äîno extra setup required.
  2. Test & Run for Free: Activate our limited-time promotional offer to run your custom agents with zero execution costs from now throughout January, 2026.

To activate the offer:

1. Navigate to the Control Tower in your SAP Build tenant.

2. Select AI Agent Builder Activation.

3. Enable agent builder, by accepting the terms and condition

FAQ & Common Pitfalls for Partners

Q1: I don't see the build-default plan for SAP Build in my TDD account. How do I get it?   Do not order a new paid subscription. Ensure you have the correct TDD account with BTP PAYG license. Then, go to your BTP Cockpit -> Service Marketplace. Find "SAP Build Process Automation" and create a new instance/subscription, making sure to select the build-default plan.

Q2: My Joule and SAP Build are in different Global Accounts. Is that a problem?  No, this is a common and supported partner scenario. The absolute requirement is that both global accounts' subaccounts use the same Cloud Identity Service (IAS) tenant for authentication.

Q3: I ran the booster, but Joule Studio doesn't appear, or I get an error when deploying. What's wrong? This is almost always one of three issues:

  1. Mismatched Identity Services: Your Joule and SBPA subaccounts are pointing to different IAS tenants.
  2. Incorrect SBPA Plan: You are still on the "standard" plan instead of "build-default".
  3. Incorrect Joule SKU: Make sure you have a correct Joule license under Joule service TDD SKU (8018168) at no cost. To be on the safe side, please contact with your account manager, making sure you have right SKU enabled.
  4. Missing Role Collections: Your user is missing the joule_extensibility and end_user roles in the Joule subaccount, or the necessary developer roles in the SBPA subaccount.

Q4: I followed the steps, but deployment still fails with an IdP error: This points to a deeper trust configuration issue. Verify the trust settings between your BTP subaccounts and the IAS tenant. Ensure the Integration with Joule Formation status is Ready. If the issue persists, we recommend logging a free Technical Advisory request via the SAP BTP Technical Advisory service for expert assistance.

Q5: I am experiencing an ongoing issue and require further assistance. How may I contact you? Please submit a free Technical Advisory request via the SAP BTP Technical Advisory service for expert assistance.

Helpful Resources for Setup and Activation 

  • How to get started with Joule Studio
  • Provisioning Joule Studio 
  • Enabling Joule Studio for existing customers 
  • Step by Step Video Guide for Joule Studio Activation SAP BTP
  • Reference Architecture for Joule Studio 
  • Activate Joule Studio in 5 Simple Steps

entry.title: Discovery Package: Test, Demo, and Development for SAP Cloud ERP Private
entry.content:
Many partners have asked for a systems for testing, demos, and development of cloud-exclusive innovations such as AI capabilities, and Joule in a private cloud environment. Therefore we expanded our portfolio by introducing the Test, Demo and Development for SAP Cloud ERP Private, Discovery Package.

The Cloud ERP Private Discovery Package 2025 Release will be launched in December 2025.

It is currently available only to partners, with more information and the ordering process provided on the central landing page in the Partner Portal.
 

What is the SAP Cloud ERP Private Discovery Package?

The Discovery Package is the SAP Cloud ERP Private successor to the on-premise SAP S/4HANA Fully-Activated Appliance. It provides a SAP Cloud ERP Private system with:

- SAP S/4HANA core scope
- pre-activated Best Practice content
- additional demo scenarios
- a rich collection of continuously updated demo guides
- the option to connect your BTP account for Joule services

You can adjust configurations as needed and unlock additional scope (e.g. via business functions) if the required software components are installed‚Äîfully documented as part of the offering. The system is ideal for use cases like Fit-to-Standard analyses, exploring and demonstrating Cloud Private innovations and adding custom configurations to showcase extensions.
The system includes multiple clients for the different use cases:
- Client 000 ‚Äì SAP Reference Client
- Client 100 ‚Äì Preconfigured demo scenarios
- Client 200 ‚Äì Activate content yourself
- Client 400 ‚Äì Compare Best Practices across localizations

Key Benefits

Build and showcase your SAP Cloud ERP Private solutions to customers in your own dedicated system
Use a pre-configured SAP Cloud ERP Private system to develop your own content and test and demo SAP Cloud ERP solutions to your customers.

Explore and tailor the system to your business needs
Use curated demo guides to walk through activated best practices and extend scenarios. Customize users, content, and processes freely. Replace the system anytime with the latest version.

Leverage ready-to-use content with AI and Joule integration
Benefit from activated best practices, enriched demo data, and evolving curated guides. Discover how embedded AI and Joule enhance business processes and decision-making.

Seamlessly integrate with your SAP BTP environment
Unlock the full potential of SAP Business AI and other SAP BTP services by connecting your system with your SAP BTP account.

Develop and extend with clean core principles
Support modern development workflows including GitHub integration, SAINT for add-ons, and side-by-side extensions via BTP. Maintain a clean core while innovating flexibly.

Launch quickly with self services in SAP for Me
Experience efficient service provisioning and management with SAP for Me. Stay agile Stay agile with a self-service approach that allows for direct action.

Some Specifics

Refer to the Getting Started Guide for detailed information.

System Access
From local computers, the TDD system can be accessed via HTTPS only:
- SAP WebGUI, SAP Fiori Launchpad, and other HTTPS-enabled UI components of S/4
- ABAP Development Tools (ADT) via HTTPS-enabled logon
This ensures secure connectivity and compliance with cloud security standards.

Development Scope
‚Ä¢ Tooling:
- WebGUI-based transactions (e.g., SE38/SE80; no ABAP Debugger)
- ADT (including debugging view and more)
‚Ä¢ Partners are responsible for transferring development artifacts (git-based CTS recommended).
‚Ä¢ Add-on Assembly Kit is available but offered separately by ICC.
‚Ä¢ SAP Notes and other non-OS-based patches can be applied with an entitled partner S-User.

Provisioning and Management with SAP for Me

Ordering is simple: Place your request via Partner Portal, and the system will appear in SAP for Me once the order is booked. Provisioning takes about 90 minutes. For security place your IP ranges and then the system is ready to use.

You can provision a Cloud Private system with the latest version, which will be Cloud ERP Private 2025 in the second half of December 2025.
If you already have the 2023 FPS03 version of the Discovery Package running, you can simply reprovision from the 2025 template in SAP for Me‚Äîno need to go through the ordering process again.
We release a new version with every Feature Pack Stack (FPS) or general release, and you can reprovision to newer (or older) versions under the same subscription. You can also run multiple subscriptions in parallel.

In SAP for Me, you can also trigger service requests such as:
- Restrict Access (mandatory)
- System Reboot
- System Reprovisioning
- System Backup (weekly backups included)
- System Restore from Backup
- Enable ABAP Namespace for Development

The Discovery Package will continue to evolve, with additional use cases and capabilities planned for future releases.
