entry.title: Steps by Step Guide to enable Joule in Fiori launchpad for S4HANA 2025 Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am writing this blog which have the steps to enable the Joule Communication Scenario on your SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance and integrate Joule Web Client plugin in your SAP Fiori Launchpad, allowing your users to interact with Joule.

Below are the steps that are needed to achieve this.

  • Enable Joule Services, Cloud Identity Services (Connectivity) & SAP Build Work Zone , Standard Edition in a subaccount .
  • Establish Trust of Subaccount with the Identity Authentication tenant (IAS)
  • Configure Trusted Domain in SAP BTP
  • Enable Fiori launchpad login using your Identity Authentication tenant 
  • Configure Trusted Domains in Identity Authentication
  • Expose SAP Fiori Launchpad Content to SAP BTP
  • Set Up SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition as a Content Provider
  • Activating SAP Build Work Zone , SAP Joule & Cloud identity services in subaccount
  • Run the Joule Booster
  • Configure Destinations in BTP 
  • Configure Identity Provisioning Service
  • Configure and Activate Joule Plug-In in a Target Mapping

Note-1 : Your Cloud Identity Tenant and you BTP subaccount should be in same region 

Note-2 : In this blog we are using our corporate IDP to login to our BTP , IAS and Fiori.

Note-3 : Enablement of Joule is also available with Cloud Integration Automation service in which several steps are automated you can refer to below blog if you want to perform this automatically

Joule provisioning with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using Cloud Integration Automation service 

 

Lets begin the manual setup

Enable Joule Services, Cloud Identity Services (Connectivity) & SAP Build Work Zone , Standard Edition in a subaccount .

Login to BTP subaccount in which you want to activate Joule.

click on enable cloud foundry - It will prompt you the name you want to keep you can keep default setting and click okay.

Go to entitlement and get services - Joule (foundation), SAP Built work Zone standard edition & SAP Cloud identity services (connectivity)

 

click on add 3 service plans --> Click save

Establish Trust of Subaccount with the Identity Authentication tenant (IAS)

Go to trust configuration in your BTP subaccount

click on establish trust

 

click next and choose the domain & click next and finish the wizard

Configure Trusted Domain in SAP BTP

  1. Go to your subaccount and choose Security  Settings.

  2. Choose + (Add).

  3. Enter the host name for the trusted domain.

  4. For example: https://store.example.com

  5. All the trusted domains together, including their space separators, can't exceed 2048 characters.

  6. Save your entries.

 

add your Fiori URL domain here.

Enable Fiori launchpad login using your Identity Authentication tenant 

This is critical step in the configuration because all BTP services works with IAS authentication and our on premise solution i.e. S4HANA should also work with IAS authentication.

Below are steps to achieve this.

  1. Get the SAML Metadata of Your Identity Authentication Tenant
  2. Create an App for Your SAP S/4HANA Solution
  3. Enable the ABAP Platform as an SAML Service Provider
  4. Trust Identity Authentication as an Identity Provider
  5. Set the Name ID Format for Your ABAP Platform Client
  6. Trust the ABAP Platform Client as a Service Provider
  7. Configuring the Subject Name Identifier Consumed by the ABAP Platform

I will be posting detailed step by step guide on how to enable this login using corporate IDP but to make this blog limited to Joule enablement I have provided direct link to help.sap guide

Configure Trusted Domains in Identity Authentication

  1. Sign in to the administration console for SAP Cloud Identity Services.

  2. Under Applications and Resources, choose the Tenant Settings tile.

    At the top of the page, you can view the administrative and license relevant information of the tenant.

  3. Under Customization, choose the Trusted Domains list item

  4. Press the + Add button.

  5. Type the URL of the trusted host in the field.

    You can type either the full name of the host or you can use the wild card * function.

    Caution

    Be careful when using the wild card * function. Make sure that you trust the domain when you use it.

    See the examples:

    mycompany.ondemand.com

    *.example.com

  6. Save your changes.

    If the operation is successful the system displays the message Trusted Domains updated.

Expose SAP Fiori Launchpad Content to SAP BTP

login to your S4HANA ABAP system

run tcode /n/UI2/CDM3_EXP_SCOPE

click on expose content

here we choose version 1 (note icf service  /sap/bc/ui2/cdm3 is activated)

 

Set Up SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition as a Content Provider

This step have few sub steps to be done

login to SAP cloud connector and add your subaccount that you created

 

you can download the authentication data file from the BTP subaccount --> connectivity --> Cloud connector  --> download authentication data

Then you can upload the same here 

select the subaccount which you added and click on cloud to on-premise

create two connections a) HTTPS and b) RFC as shown below

Activating SAP Build Work Zone , SAP Joule & Cloud identity services in subaccount

Go to your subaccount and click in instance and subscription

create below 3 services

you need to create instance for SAP Build work zone and create service key as well

 

Run Joule booster

Go to global account and select booster

Here carefully select your S4HANA private cloud system and your SAP Build work zone instance

it will create formation for joule to work

Configure destinations

In this steps you need to create 5 destinations 

  • Design-time Destination
  • Runtime Destination
  • Destination for retrieving nomination via SAP Cloud connector
  • Create a content provider
  • Single Sign-on Destination

Design-time Destination

In the SAP BTP cockpit, in your subaccount, navigate to Connectivity  Destinations.

Use the following properties to define the design-time destination:

Runtime Destination

Destination for retrieving nomination via SAP Cloud connector

Create content provider

  1. In the SAP BTP cockpit, log on to your subaccount as administrator.

  2. In your subaccount, go to Instances and Subscriptions and launch SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

  3. In SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, go to Channel Manager.

  4. Choose + New to add a new content provider.

 

 

Single-Sign on destination

 

Configure Identity Provisioning Service

Follow below link to perform this step

Configure Identity Provisioning Service 

 

Configure and Activate Joule Plug-In in a Target Mapping

Create Catalog in Fiori Launchpad

Go to the T-code: /n/UI2/FLP in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition system and Open the Fiori Launchpad Tab. Click on the Launchpad App Manager (Cross Client).

Create a new Techincal Catalog by clicking on the New Standard Catalog.

Click on ADD APP -> SAPUI5 Fiori App.

In the launchpad app manager (see e.g. Creating and Maintaining Launchpad App Descriptor Items), create a target mapping with the intent Shell-plugin and the following configuration:

In PFCG you can create role Z:Joule_S4HANA and add catalog to the role 

Then you can assign this role to the users you want joule icon to be enabled.

 

Now configuration is completed and you can login to fiori launchpad

entry.title: Prompt-Driven Development: Building Full-Stack SAP CAP Apps from User Stories
entry.content:
Introduction

  • What if you could translate a business requirement into a functional, full-stack application with a single prompt?
  • How much faster could you deliver value if the foundational code and project scaffolding were generated for you in seconds?

This is the new reality powered by SAP Build Code and its integrated AI copilot, Joule.

As a turn-key environment on the SAP Business Technology Platform, it unifies the entire development lifecycle, from coding to deployment.

This post demonstrates how to build a full-stack SAP CAP application directly from a user story, showcasing how

generative AI is fundamentally reshaping the developer experience.

 

Business Requirement

Build an SAP CAP application based on the requirements in the user story below:

User Story

As a contract administrator, I want to create and manage contracts and ‚Äòparties involved‚Äô information in the system,

so that I can effectively track and handle legal agreements and ‚Äòparties involved‚Äô interactions.

Contracts can cover a vast range of agreements, such as sales contracts, service agreements and employment contracts.

Party involved: A ‚Äòparty involved‚Äô is an individual, organization, or entity that purchases goods, products, or services from another party,

typically a business or seller.

Common attributes of a contract might include:

  1. Contract ID: A unique identifier for the contract.
  2. Party involved Identification Number: A unique identification number for the party involved.
  3. Contract Type: The type of contract (e.g. sales, service, employment).
  4. Start Date: The date on which the contract becomes valid.
  5. End Date: The date on which the contract expires (if applicable).
  6. Status: The current status of the contract (draft, active, expired, terminated, etc.)

A typical ‚Äòparty involved‚Äô has the following attributes:

  1. Party involved Identification Number
  2. Party involved Name: It refers to the given name of a person or entity, or a label by which they are addressed or identified.
  3. Party involved Address: It refers to a physical location where an individual, business, or entity is situated or can be reached.
  4. Party involved Contact Information

Acceptance Criteria

Scenario 1: List All Contracts

Given I am logged into the contract management system, when I launch the SAP Fiori application to maintain contracts,

then I should be able to view the list of all the contracts in a list without pressing the GO button.

The list of all the contracts should have : Contract ID, Party involved Identification Number, Contract Type and Start Date. 

The list of filters should include Contract Type, Contract Status and Start Date.

Scenario 2: View Contract Details 

Given I am logged into the contract management system, when I select a specific contract from the list of SAP Fiori application,

then I should be able to view the contract details and parties involved information.

 

Joule's Generative AI-based SAP CAP App Development

Prerequisites

  • Get a Free Account on SAP BTP Trial
  • Setup SAP Build Code

1. Create a New Project using SAP Build Lobby

Create a Project

 

Click the Application Tile

Full-Stack

Full-Stack Node.JS

Contract Management

Contract Management

Project Created

2. Build a Full-Stack CAP Application via Prompt

Click the created project to open it in SAP Business Application Studio

Open Joule From the Activity Bar and  select the ‚Äô/cap-gen-app` slash command

Generate a CAP Application

Prompt the user story description(refer to Business Requirement section above) to Joule and click send.

Joule tackles complex tasks by breaking them into steps, each with a suggested prompt.

Diffrerent Steps

To simplify the process and provide full context, replace the content of each step with the complete user story prompt.

Then, save and run to generate each step's artifacts.

Accept the Code.

Accept the Code

Generated Artifacts

3. Add UI to the Application

Create a new Fiori elements Application.

Fiori Elements Application

 

3. Preview the Application

Click run to preview the Application.

Run the Application

The application‚Äôs preview is displayed.

Application Preview

Launch the contract management app.

Contract Management

Select a contract from the list to view its details.

Select Contract

 

Contract details

Conclusion

The journey from user story to a functional, full-stack application‚Äîonce a multi-day endeavor‚Äîis now accomplished in minutes.

With SAP Build Code and its AI copilot, Joule, this dramatic acceleration signals a fundamental paradigm shift.

The developer's role is being elevated from the meticulous craft of writing code to the strategic art of guiding its creation.

Joule operates as the quintessential collaborator, executing the foundational groundwork to liberate developers to focus

on high-value business logic and innovation.

SAP Build Code is therefore more than a tool; it's the dawn of an era where the speed of technology finally

matches the ambition of business.

 

Further Information

SAP Build Code

#SAPBuildCode #Joule #SAPBTP

 

______________________________________________________________________________________________

 

 

Best Regards,
Anuradha Dhingan

entry.title: ü§ñ SAP BTP Weekly¬†| Edici√≥n de cierre 2025
entry.content:
Cierro el √∫ltimo newsletter del a√±o con una mirada clara: CIOs acelerando con foco, CFOs pidiendo impacto medible, arquitectos cuidando el core y consultores redefiniendo su rol. En estas l√≠neas repaso c√≥mo SAP BTP, Joule y Business Data Cloud dejaron de ser promesa en 2025 y empiezan a sentar las bases de c√≥mo vamos a trabajar, decidir e innovar en 2026.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Joule for Developers: IA para acelerar la adopci√≥n sin perder control del c√≥digo

SAP potencia a los desarrolladores con Joule for Developers, integrado en el ciclo de desarrollo para acelerar tareas repetitivas. La IA ayuda a generar y adaptar c√≥digo dentro del contexto de SAP BTP sin perder est√°ndares de calidad. Esto no reemplaza la l√≥gica de dise√±o, pero reduce el tiempo en tareas t√©cnicas b√°sicas. Impulsa la adopci√≥n de IA en entornos empresariales con pr√°cticas seguras. El foco es mantener clean core mientras se ampl√≠a la productividad.

Seg√∫n SAP, esta capacidad est√° pensada para que los developers no solo codifiquen m√°s r√°pido, sino con mayor confianza y alineados al est√°ndar de la empresa. La ventaja principal es eliminar fricci√≥n en actividades tediosas y permitir que el equipo se concentre en l√≥gica de negocio. El desaf√≠o es integrar estas asistencias en pipelines existentes sin perder gobernanza.

üîó https://news.sap.com/latinamerica/2025/11/sap-empodera-a-los-desarrolladores-para-acelerar-la-adopcion-de-la-ia-en-el-mundo-empresarial/

2Ô∏è‚É£ Joule for Consultants: acelerando entregas y calidad de proyectos SAP

SAP Joule for Consultants ya est√° disponible y dise√±ado para asistir a consultores en transformaciones SAP a gran escala con gu√≠a inteligente y contexto experto.

¬∑ Reduce tiempo de b√∫squeda de documentaci√≥n, interpretaci√≥n de c√≥digo y adopci√≥n de mejores pr√°cticas, apoyado en una base de conocimiento profundamente curada por SAP.

¬∑ Puede acelerar la ejecuci√≥n de proyectos hasta ~14 % y disminuir iteraciones de dise√±o y retrabajo.

¬∑  La integraci√≥n con herramientas como Microsoft 365 Copilot ofrece un flujo fluido entre contextos.

Esto permite que los consultores se concentren m√°s en decisiones de negocio que en tareas repetitivas.

Un caso concreto viene de grandes firmas de consultor√≠a que est√°n adoptando Joule for Consultants para mejorar tiempos de entrega y calidad del servicio a clientes: por ejemplo, Deloitte anunci√≥ que la soluci√≥n les permite acceder r√°pidamente a pr√°cticas l√≠deres y contenido SAP exclusivo, liberando tiempo para actividades de mayor impacto estrat√©gico en SAP Engage y proyectos de transformaci√≥n integral.

M√°s all√° de m√©tricas de tiempo ahorrado, el impacto real se ve en mejor alineaci√≥n entre dise√±o t√©cnico y necesidades del cliente, reduciendo rework y elevando la confianza en decisiones durante el ciclo del proyecto. El reto para muchas organizaciones ser√° definir m√©tricas claras de impacto (KPIs) que puedan medir estos beneficios en cada entrega.

üîó https://www.sap.com/latinamerica/products/artificial-intelligence/ai-assistant/sap-consulting-capability.html

3Ô∏è‚É£ Joule Studio: agentes de IA que ejecutan procesos, no solo tareas

Joule Studio permite crear agentes de IA en SAP Build. Los agentes ejecutan workflows con contexto de negocio. No es solo RPA, es automatizaci√≥n inteligente. Se reduce c√≥digo y tiempo de dise√±o. La gobernanza se vuelve cr√≠tica.

Imaginar un agente que gestione excepciones de facturaci√≥n o approvals complejos ya no es ciencia ficci√≥n. El desaf√≠o real es definir l√≠mites, auditor√≠a y ‚Äúhuman-in-the-loop‚Äù. La ventaja es eficiencia; el riesgo, cajas negras operativas.

üîó https://www.sap.com/products/artificial-intelligence/joule-studio.html

4Ô∏è‚É£ Nuevos skills SAP: del funcional t√©cnico al ‚ÄúAI-enabled consultant‚Äù

La llegada de Joule cambia los perfiles SAP. Menos foco en ejecuci√≥n manual. M√°s foco en dise√±o, validaci√≥n y gobierno. Los skills t√©cnicos se combinan con negocio. La capacitaci√≥n se vuelve estrat√©gica.

Saber configurar ya no alcanza. Entender procesos, datos e IA ser√° diferencial. SAP impulsa nuevas certificaciones, pero el reto est√° en reconvertir talento existente. Ventaja: perfiles m√°s completos. Riesgo: brecha de skills si no se act√∫a a tiempo.

üîó https://training.sap.com

5Ô∏è‚É£ SAP BDC Connect + Microsoft Fabric: datos SAP donde el negocio ya trabaja

SAP anunci√≥ Business Data Cloud Connect para Microsoft Fabric, extendiendo la integraci√≥n de BDC con la plataforma de datos de Microsoft. Esto habilita acceso bi-direccional sin copia de datos entre BDC y Microsoft Fabric OneLake, preservando contexto sem√°ntico. Los equipos pueden usar SAP data products directamente en Fabric para analytics, AI y BI. Potencia herramientas como Power BI, Copilot Studio y agentes de IA dentro del ecosistema Microsoft. El enfoque acelera insights y reduce la fricci√≥n de replicar datos.

En la pr√°ctica, esto significa que los datos SAP ya gobernados en BDC pueden ser usados en vivo en herramientas cotidianas del negocio (Power BI, Excel, Teams) sin mover o duplicar la informaci√≥n. La ventaja es una sola fuente de verdad que impulsa tanto AI generativa como anal√≠tica avanzada. El reto principal est√° en coordinar roles y seguridad entre plataformas diferentes, especialmente en organizaciones grandes donde existen m√∫ltiples silos y pol√≠ticas de acceso.

üîó https://news.sap.com/2025/11/sap-bdc-connect-for-microsoft-fabric-business-insights-ai-innovation/

6Ô∏è‚É£ IA + Datos nativos: SAP HANA Cloud, agentic memory y cero-copias con Snowflake

SAP HANA Cloud se consolida como la base de datos AI-native con Model Context Protocol (MCP) disponible en GA, permitiendo a agentes IA navegar relaciones complejas de datos. Los knowledge graphs autom√°ticos agilizan la generaci√≥n de modelos sem√°nticos del negocio sin semanas de esfuerzo manual (Q1 2026). La incorporaci√≥n de agentic memory permite a agentes de IA aprender de interacciones pasadas para decisiones m√°s inteligentes. SAP BDC se integra con Snowflake como extensi√≥n para habilitar datos sem√°nticamente ricos con zero-copy, preservando contexto y gobernanza. Esto impulsa una visi√≥n donde datos empresariales e IA coexisten con escalabilidad y menor duplicaci√≥n.

Hacia fines de 2025 SAP reporta cientos de casos de uso de Business AI con impacto medible en valor de negocio. MCP en HANA Cloud permite que agentes IA entiendan estructuras m√°s all√° de filas y columnas, abarcando relaciones complejas y b√∫squedas sem√°nticas. La generaci√≥n autom√°tica de knowledge graphs y la memoria agentic reducen tiempo de preparaci√≥n y elevan la inteligencia contextual de los agentes.

Por otro lado, la integraci√≥n de SAP BDC con Snowflake habilita zero-copy data sharing, reduciendo silos y costos de replicaci√≥n sin perder gobernanza. Esto abre modelos h√≠bridos donde SAP conserva el contexto sem√°ntico y Snowflake aporta escala e innovaci√≥n para anal√≠tica y AI.

üîó https://news.sap.com/2025/11/business-ai-innovation-unveiled-at-sap-teched/

7Ô∏è‚É£ Reflexi√≥n de fin de a√±o: de experimentar con IA a redise√±ar la empresa para 2026

2025 fue el a√±o donde SAP dej√≥ claro que la IA empresarial ya es real. Joule pas√≥ de asistente a agente, y los datos dejaron de ser solo reporting. BTP, BDC y HANA Cloud se alinearon en una visi√≥n coherente. La conversaci√≥n cambi√≥ de ‚Äúqu√© probar‚Äù a ‚Äúqu√© escalar‚Äù. El foco ahora est√° en impacto, no en hype.

Mirando todo lo anunciado este a√±o, Joule en sus distintas formas, Business Data Cloud conectando ecosistemas como Microsoft Fabric y Snowflake, HANA Cloud volvi√©ndose AI-native, creo que 2026 no va a tratar de sumar m√°s tecnolog√≠a, sino de tomar decisiones m√°s valientes. Las organizaciones que lleguen a 2026 con datos gobernados, skills preparados y una visi√≥n clara de d√≥nde usar IA tendr√°n una ventaja enorme. Las que sigan en pilotos aislados van a sentir que ‚Äúllegaron tarde‚Äù, aunque la tecnolog√≠a est√© ah√≠. SAP puso las piezas sobre la mesa; ahora el desaf√≠o es cultural, organizacional y estrat√©gico.

entry.title: The Art of Possible: My Experience with SAP Ariba and WalkMe
entry.content:
A Digital Transformation Leader's Journey üíº
    I've been working with Procurement transformation project using S4 , Oracle , SAP Ariba and WalkMe since 2023, and I want to share some practical insights from my experience. After SAP acquired WalkMe in September 2024, this combination has become even more important for procurement transformations. ‚ú®
    Why I Started Looking at Digital Adoption Platforms ü§î
    Early in my career, I thought good system configuration and proper training were enough. But I was wrong. üòÖ Users would complete training, get certificates, and then still struggle with the system. They forgot what they learned within weeks, created their own shortcuts, and kept calling the helpdesk.
    This is when I started exploring Digital Adoption Platforms like WalkMe. The idea was simple - instead of making users remember training, why not guide them exactly when they need help? üí°
    My First WalkMe Implementation with SAP Ariba üéØ
    In order to address System adoption challenge , we decided to use Walk-me for Ariba Guided buying transformation. We did a Business Value Assessment workshops with WalkMe's team. As part of those workshops we examinsed various workflows / Process flow and tried understanding user journey and when and how user are getting dropped and potential reasons behind it .
    They helped us understand where exactly users were getting stuck. It wasn't where we thought! For example, we assumed requisition creation was the problem, but users were actually struggling with basic catalog search and navigation. üîç
    As outcome of this exercise we finalized 3 workflows for which we decided to develop walk-me content .
    How WalkMe Actually Reaches End Users üñ•Ô∏è
    Let me explain the technical setup because this confused me initially. üòä
    Getting WalkMe to Users' Computers ‚öôÔ∏è
    We worked with our IT team to install the WalkMe browser extension on all users' machines. This wasn't something users could download themselves ‚Äì with help of IT had to do a mass deployment. The good thing is WalkMe provides an All-In-One Installer. Our IT team could install it across with one installation file. This saved a lot of time and ensured everyone had the same setup. ‚úÖ
    This installation was also done in phases where in region wise we installed to respective usebase.
    How Login and Access Works üîê
    Here's something nice - WalkMe doesn't need separate login credentials. When users log into SAP Ariba Guided buying through our Single Sign-On (SSO), WalkMe automatically picks up those credentials. Users don't have to remember another password or do anything extra. üëç
    Once they're logged into Ariba Guided buying , WalkMe content appears automatically based on their role/persona and what they're doing in the system. From the user's side, it just feels like Ariba has become more helpful.
    What Users Actually See
    Users see a small Walk Me widget (usually in the corner) and helpful tips that pop up when needed. They don't need to do anything special - the help just appears at the right time. The extension runs quietly in the background, watching what users are doing and showing guidance when required.
    Building WalkMe Content: The Editor Tool & more üõ†Ô∏è
    Now, creating this content is a different story. As someone building the guidance, I use the WalkMe Editor.
    The Editor Setup üíª
    The WalkMe Editor is a desktop application that I install on my laptop. Along with it, there's an Editor Extension for the browser - this is different from what end users have. This confused me at first! üòÖ
    The desktop app connects to my browser through this Editor Extension. This way, I can build content while looking at the actual Ariba screen side by side.
    When You Need Technical Skills üë®‚Äçüíª
    For our receiving compliance solution (which I'll explain later), we had some write programming which involves jQuery and some HTML , CSS skills as that use case of bit complex .

    My Recommendation on Building Content
    In my experience, about 80% of WalkMe content can be built using drag-and-drop. The remaining 20% needs some degree of programming. Either have someone on your team who knows JavaScript, or pair your business users with a developer for the complex parts.In our case , Walk-me product experts helped us time to time .
    A Real Problem We Solved: Open Receiving Tasks üéØ
    Let me share a specific challenge we faced during our Procurement transformation and how WalkMe helped us.
    The Problem ‚ö†Ô∏è
    We found that many users not completing receiving action in Ariba GB on time .This was causing supplier payment delay.
    Our Solution Using WalkMe üí°
    We created a WalkMe ShoutOut (that's the popup notification) for users who had receiving tasks pending for more than one year. When they logged in, they saw a friendly but firm message: "You have pending receiving tasks that need attention."
    The message included a guided walkthrough that took them directly to the receiving screen and showed them how to complete these tasks step by step.
    We also added a process gate - if users tried to create a new requisition without completing their old receiving tasks, they'd see a reminder to complete them first. This wasn't about being strict; it was about maintaining data quality and helping users build better habits.

    AI Generated Mock-up for ideation.

    What Happened ‚úÖ
    Within six weeks, the backlog of old receiving tasks was significantly reduced. More importantly, users started completing their receiving tasks on time. Its also reduced ticket volume for these issue with our support team.

    How its can help for S4 HANA transformations
    As now many organizations transitioning their ERP to latest version of S4 HANA , I belive walk-me can really good tool which expedites this . In normal scenario ,S4 HANA changes will have heavy dependency of ABAPer or SAP Technical resources but with walk-me such temporary changes can be managed in much shorter period .
    Eg.
    If for Particular Search help of Supplier we wanted hide some suppliers name or don‚Äôt want to allow selection of supplier this changes will need ABAP programming .
    If such change is temporary in nature and after Supplier maintaince is complete , we wanted to revert change then it can be easily managed using Walk-me .

    Some common Use-cases possible in Ariba / S4 HANA
    ‚Ä¢ Smart walkthrough for Ariba Sourcing Event creation
    ‚Ä¢ Smart walkthrough for Ariba Non-Catalog PR
    ‚Ä¢ Temporarily hiding or blocking specific UI elements or buttons on Screens
    ‚Ä¢ Temporarily controlling user accesses during site migration
    ‚Ä¢ For Guided tour & as Companion offering help content is alongside respective Ariba Solution like Sourcing , SLP , GB etc.

    Challenges I've Faced üòÖ
    Not everything has been smooth. Here are some real challenges:
    ‚Ä¢ Keeping Content Updated üîÑ: When Ariba releases updates, WalkMe content sometimes breaks. You need to regularly review and update it - this requires discipline.
    ‚Ä¢ Some Users Find It Annoying üòí: Power users who know the system well sometimes find WalkMe guidance intrusive. I make most content dismissible, and check analytics to see what users are consistently ignoring.
    ‚Ä¢ Maintenance Takes Effort ‚öôÔ∏è: Creating WalkMe content is relatively easy, but keeping it current as business processes change needs proper ownership and governance.
    ‚Ä¢ Multi-System Complexity üîó: In companies using both SAP and non-SAP systems, ensuring consistent WalkMe experience across all systems needs careful planning.
    Results I've Seen üìà
    Every organization is different, but here are some consistent patterns:
    ‚Ä¢ Training time for new users has reduced noticeably ‚è±Ô∏è
    ‚Ä¢ Helpdesk gets fewer "how do I" questions üìû
    ‚Ä¢ Data quality in requisitions and purchase orders has improved ‚úÖ
    ‚Ä¢ Business process changes / critical announcements can be communicated faster through Walk-Me than waiting for formal training sessions or meetings üöÄ
    ‚Ä¢ Change management teams feel more empowered to help users quickly üí™
    Practical Tips for Digital Transformation Leaders üí°
    If you're considering WalkMe for SAP Ariba or S4HANA, here's my advice:
    ‚Ä¢ Do Proper Assessment üîç: Talk to your users and check analytics to understand where they actually struggle, not where you think they struggle.
    ‚Ä¢ Involve Real Users Early üë•: Test your WalkMe content with actual end users before rolling it out. Their feedback can be surprising but very valuable.
    ‚Ä¢ Build in Small Pieces üß©: Create reusable content blocks. A tooltip used in multiple places is better than creating separate content everywhere.
    ‚Ä¢ Plan for Ownership üìã: Decide who will maintain WalkMe content, how often it gets reviewed, and how updates are managed. This isn't exciting work but it's critical.
    ‚Ä¢ Measure Business Impact üìä: Don't just look at WalkMe analytics. Check if requisition completion rates improved, if policy compliance increased, if support tickets reduced.
    ‚Ä¢ Start Small üå±: Begin with one critical process or one user group or region. Prove the value, then expand.
    Final Thoughts üí≠
    Working with WalkMe and SAP Ariba /S4 HANA has taught me that technology transformation is really about people. The best procurement system won't deliver value if users can't or won't use it properly.
    WalkMe isn't a magic solution. ü™Ñ It's a useful tool that, when implemented thoughtfully and maintained regularly, can significantly improve how users work with SAP Ariba.
    The art of the possible isn't about fancy technology - it's about making technology work better for people who use it every day. ‚ù§Ô∏è

    The Way forward with Walk-me + SAP Joule
    The road ahead looks promising as WalkMe and SAP Joule continue to merge into a unified, intelligent experience layer. The Sapphire 2025 demo was just a preview of what‚Äôs coming. WalkMe‚Äôs real‚Äëtime guidance and automation will increasingly amplify Joule‚Äôs generative AI capabilities ‚Äî creating a powerful model where Joule provides the intelligence, and WalkMe drives the execution.
    These are my personal observations from my experience in digital transformation. Results may vary based on your organization's specific situation.

entry.title: MCP Server for SAP ECC & S/4HANA: Unlimited ABAP Add-On for Display, Create and Update Tools
entry.content:
Introduction

It‚Äôs time to simplify integration processes between Agentic SDKs and SAP ECC & S/4HANA systems. We‚Äôd like to introduce an ABAP add-on that brings an MCP Server directly into your SAP ERP system and supports SAP ABAP releases down to 7.01.

Sounds attractive? Then let‚Äôs take a look at the architecture.

Architecture

The architecture is simple. We kept in mind that you may want to avoid middleware (such as SAP BTP applications or similar solutions) while retaining full control over:

  • Tool descriptions
    These are essential for AI orchestration‚Äìfriendly tool definitions. Standard SAP descriptions of services, tables, or other ABAP objects are not sufficient to build scalable Business AI solutions.

  • Data provisioning
    We provide a simple mechanism that allows you to nominate Tables, Views, and CDS Views to provision data to an Agentic SDK.

  • Create / Update / Delete tool onboarding
    We offer an easy mechanism to develop ABAP classes for create, update, and delete actions. Each tool requires only one method for the action and one method for metadata description.

This is how you can integrate it into any Agentic SDK:

Pic. 1. MCP Server at the SAP backend system level

What Does ‚ÄúUnlimited Display Tools‚Äù Mean?

There is an ABAP view where you can onboard Tables, Views, and CDS Views for data provisioning. Each object is automatically converted into a tool by the MCP Server.

 Pic. 2. Nomination of Tables, Views, and CDS Views for data provisioning via MCP Server

How Do You Develop Tools for Create / Update / Delete Actions?

We provide an ABAP interface that helps you create an ABAP class for each tool.

 Pic. 3. MCP Server tool creation for Create / Update / Delete actions

Really Any Agentic SDK?

Yes, absolutely. Here is an example of MCP Server consumption in ChatGPT.

The MCP Server can be connected either directly via an SICF node or through the SAP Cloud Connector.

 Pic. 4. MCP Server SICF node

In ChatGPT, you can connect the SAP MCP Server in developer mode:

 Pic. 5. Connecting MCP Server in ChatGPT

Once connected, you have direct access to SAP backend data from ChatGPT:

 Pic. 6. Leave request creation from ChatGPT via Skybuffer AI MCP Server

 Pic. 7. Purchase order data display from ChatGPT via Skybuffer AI MCP Server

Can Skybuffer AI MCP Server Work with SAP Joule?

Yes, absolutely. You can connect the MCP Server directly to an SAP Joule tool in SAP Joule Studio.

Conclusion

You now have a powerful, scalable MCP Server operating directly at the ABAP layer. You can provide high-quality tool descriptions, fully control display tool provisioning, and easily onboard create, update, and delete tools without the need to build OData services on top of them.

The solution works with any Agentic SDK and is ready for enterprise deployment as an ABAP add-on.

entry.title: Introducing Our Next EGI: Joule Prerequisites and Activation
entry.content:
Program Overview: 

This 3-day implementation program equips your team with the knowledge and hands-on experience needed to successfully deploy SAP‚Äôs AI-powered digital assistant, Joule. Through expert-led sessions and guided configuration exercises, participants will navigate the complex technical architecture and complete critical pre-requisites for a production ready Joule implementation. 

 

What You‚Äôll Achieve 

 

Day 1 ‚Äì Foundation and Architecture 

Gain a comprehensive understanding of Joule‚Äôs architecture and the Business Technology Platform (BTP) ecosystem. You will explore how critical components ‚Äì Cloud Identity Services (CIS), Build Work Zone (BWZ), BTP and Line-of-Business solutions ‚Äì interconnect to power Joule‚Äôs capabilities. Through live demonstrations and hands-on exercises, participants will navigate BTP account structures, understand entitlements and subscriptions, and validate system prerequisites. By the end of day one, you will have assessed your organisations readiness and begun to configure your dedicated Joule environment. 

On a BTP account we will have a live demo after integration with SuccessFactors 

 Hands On 

Translate theory into action. Guided by our experts, you will step into your own BTP environment to assess your landscape, confirm sub-accounts, validate key subscriptions and officially designate your primary Joule subaccount.  

 

Day 2 ‚Äì Integration and Activation 

Build on foundational knowledge with deep-dive sessions into identity management and user provisioning. Learn how Cloud Identity Systems integrates with your corporate Identity Provider and enables secure authentication for Joule. Configure Build Work Zone to serve as the unified interface where Joule delivers AI-powered insights across your SAP landscape. Participants will complete provisioning tasks, establish trust relationships between systems and expose content from your chosen Line-of-Business solutions. 

 Hands On 

You will execute the final configuration pieces by integrating your corporate Identity Provider with CIS, establishing system trusts, running user provisioning and exposing content from a live LOB solution into Build Work Zone. You will leave the session with a configured and functional platform ready for activation. 

 

Day 3 ‚Äì Wrap Up and Trouble Shooting 

This is your dedication implementation support session. This day is reserved for you to work directly with our SAP experts in a hands-on, collaborative session. They will help you troubleshoot any specific issues encountered during the previous two days. 

 

Program Deliverables 

  • Completed BTP environment configuration with designated Joule sub-account 
  • Configured identity management and user provisioning workflows 
  • Build Work Zone instance integrated with your SAP applications 
  • Validated prerequisites checklist ensuring deployment readiness 
  • Expert guidance on common implementation challenges and best practices 

 

Who Should Attend 

Technical Architects, Security and Identity Management Specialists, BTP administrators and Architects, and SAP BASIS professionals responsible for implementing and managing SAP‚Äôs AI and integration technologies. 

 

Investment Value 

Accelerate your Joule deployment while avoiding common pitfalls. Our expert-guided approach ensures your team develops competency in managing SAP‚Äôs AI infrastructure, maximising your return on investment.

entry.title: Empowering Teams to Streamline Sales and Service Operations with SAP Build Joule Skills
entry.content:
üåüIntroduction to SAP Build Joule Skills

In today‚Äôs fast-changing business landscape, automation, intelligence, and integration are essential for success. SAP Build Joule Skills bring these elements together to help businesses optimize workflows, streamline project management, and automate repetitive processes like project opportunity creation, quote management, and customer service handling.

By combining SAP Joule‚Äôs intelligent automation with SAP‚Äôs enterprise-grade solutions, organizations can increase productivity, ensure accuracy, and empower employees to focus on high-value work.

üö®Please refer to the video for better understanding.üö®

ü§ñWhat Are SAP Build Joule Skills?

SAP Build Joule Skills are customizable automation capabilities built within the SAP ecosystem. They allow users to create intelligent workflows that respond to business needs ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs creating new sales opportunities, generating quotes, or handling service requests.

‚ú®Key Features of Joule Skills:

  • Automation: Reduce manual data entry by automating repetitive tasks.
  • Integration: Connect seamlessly with SAP and non-SAP systems.
  • Scalability: Create and manage skills that grow with your organization.
  • User-Friendly: Empower business users with low-code/no-code design tools.

üß† What Is SAP Build Joule?

SAP Build Joule is part of the SAP Build portfolio ‚Äî a low-code platform that enables business and IT users to collaboratively design, automate, and innovate processes. Joule brings an AI-powered digital assistant into this ecosystem, helping users perform complex tasks through simple, conversational interactions.

ü™Ñ Key Benefits:

  • Accelerated automation ‚Äì Build and deploy workflows faster.
  • No-code customization ‚Äì Design automation logic without needing deep technical skills.
  • AI-driven insights ‚Äì Use AI to make decisions faster and improve efficiency.

üåüStory:

It was another busy morning at Conva Engineering. Adrian Chase, an account manager, had a full agenda ‚Äî new project sites to manage and quotes to prepare for contractors working across the site, and a customer issue waiting for resolution.

In the past, this would have meant hours of manual coordination: filling out spreadsheets, sending multiple emails, and ensuring every quote aligned with customer requirements. But since his company adopted SAP Joule, Adrian‚Äôs workday looks very different.

He starts his day by opening SAP Joule, the AI-powered assistant integrated within the company‚Äôs SAP landscapes.

‚ÄúJoule, please create a new project.‚Äù

Joule instantly responds:

‚ÄúSure, please provide the site name, customer, and materials to be quoted.‚Äù

Adrian enters the details: the site name ‚ÄúFree Text‚Äù, the customer details, and three product codes ‚Äî 5079, 5080, and 5081.

Within moments, Joule creates the new project opportunity, generates the required quotes for the contractors bidding on the site contract, and organizes all related data within the project opportunity.

Later that morning, when a damaged product report comes in from a client, Adrian simply instructs Joule to raise a credit request.

‚ÄúA service case has been created and linked to the project,‚Äù Joule confirms.

Without opening multiple applications or chasing emails, the issue is automatically routed to customer service with sales order data for processing the credit extracted via AI, ensuring a fast response and complete traceability.

By leveraging SAP Joule, Adrian has transformed what used to be a time-consuming, manual process into an intelligent, automated workflow.

Now, he spends less time managing tasks ‚Äî and more time building relationships, exploring new opportunities, and driving strategic growth.

üß© SAP Products That Power Joule Skills

SAP Joule Skills are designed to work seamlessly across multiple SAP solutions, forming a connected ecosystem for business excellence. Here are some key SAP products that enhance and integrate with Joule:

‚öôÔ∏èSAP Build

  • The foundation for creating Joule Skills.
  • Allows both business users and developers to design, automate, and test workflows through a low-code environment.

üßæ SAP S/4HANA Cloud

  • Central to managing projects, quotes, and sales orders.
  • Joule connects directly with S/4HANA data to fetch customer, product, and pricing details in real time.

üí¨SAP Sales Cloud

  • Integrates with Joule to streamline the quote-to-order process.
  • Ensures sales teams can generate accurate quotes and track opportunities efficiently.

ü§ùSAP Customer Experience (CX)

  • Improves collaboration between sales and customer support.
  • Joule automates ticket creation, credit requests, and case tracking for customer satisfaction.

üß∞ SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)

  • The underlying infrastructure that connects all SAP solutions.
  • Ensures secure, scalable, and high-performance integration between Joule Skills and enterprise systems.

üíºUse Case: Project Opportunity & Quote Creation

Let‚Äôs look at a real-world example featuring Adrian Chase, a sales professional who uses SAP Joule to manage project opportunities, quotes, and service requests seamlessly.

Step 1: Create a New Project

Arian launches the Joule app from his workspace and starts a new project. Joule asks for key information such as the site name, customer details, and materials to be quoted.

Step 2:Create Opportunity

 

Opportunity created in Sales Cloud V2.

The Same Opportunity  is replicated to S4HANA public cloud as an Project 

 

S4HANA Customer Project replication from V2 Sales Opportunity 

 

Step 3: Create a Quote and Associate It with the Existing Opportunity

 

Every quote created is associated with an existing opportunity

Step 4: Handle Service Requests

Arian needs to issue a credit for a damaged product.

 

Case created is associated with an existing opportunity

 

Final 

 

Video

 

 

üöÄWhy Joule Skills Matter for Businesses

1. Time Efficiency

  • Automate manual processes like project setup, quote generation, and service requests to save time.

2. Accuracy & Data Consistency

  • Reduce errors through system-driven data capture and validation.

3. Improved Collaboration

  • Connect sales, service, and operations teams through unified data flows.

4. Scalable Innovation

  • Quickly adapt Joule Skills to handle new business needs without complex development.

5. AI-Powered Productivity

  • Leverage SAP Joule‚Äôs conversational AI to guide employees through complex workflows.

 

üåàConclusion

SAP Build Joule Skills empower organizations to automate end-to-end workflows, from project creation to customer service handling. When combined with SAP Build, SAP S/4HANA, Sales Cloud, and CX, Joule becomes a central intelligence hub that drives efficiency, consistency, and growth.

By integrating your business processes into Joule Skills, you can:

  • Reduce operational overhead,
  • Enhance customer satisfaction, and
  • Enable teams to focus on strategic goals.

üí°Start building your Joule Skills today ‚Äî and transform the way your business works with the power of SAP!

entry.title: Joule Capability Documentation Chat
entry.content:
As use cases involving AI become increasingly intertwined with our lives, we have developed a documentation chat for ABAP developers. The documentation chat is available for you to ask questions and find solutions to any ABAP development problem you may have. The conversation with the documentation chat should help you solve your tasks and serve as your helpful guide.

In this blog, we explain the rationale behind the documentation chat, how to use it, and what it offers in SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2511.

 

Rationale

Our primary goal is to provide easy access to the ABAP Cloud product documentation and to enhance the accessibility and findability of our content. Finding documentation has always been an issue that‚Äôs often caused by missing semantics in the provided content. To address this issue, we employ retrieval-augmented generation to deliver relevant information in response to a query.

 

Using the Documentation Chat

The documentation chat is available as a Joule capability in ABAP development tools for Eclipse. For information about using Joule in ABAP development tools for Eclipse, refer to Opening the Joule Chat View.

To use the documentation chat, follow these steps:

  1. In the Joule view, select the button /.
  2. Choose docs.

    If you send the request without a prompt, you receive a description of the capability.
  3. Enter your question in the text area.

     



  4. Press Enter or select the Select message (Enter) button.

    You receive a response to your question. The answer can include text, bullet points, and code examples. Also, references are always provided, allowing you to view the source documentation and verify the given answer.

 

Supported Documentation

As of SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2511, the documentation chat includes the following documentation:

  • ABAP Keyword Documentation
  • ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model
  • ABAP Data Models
  • ABAP Cloud

When chatting with the documentation, you can expect assistance with the topics in the documentation above. It is also possible to ask follow-up questions after an initial question, as the chat history is respected.

In the coming releases, you can expect more to come. Feel free to leave a comment or a like.

entry.title: From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This December
entry.content:
In the age of AI, the skills we build today will define how we work tomorrow. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve launched a monthly series of blogs that spotlight the latest AI learning assets and upcoming learning opportunities.

Building on my first blog, where I introduced you to our AI live sessions Beyond Hype (which is all about getting productive with SAP Business AI), let me follow up with you on your most asked questions:

  1. What are the prerequisites to set up a Generative AI hub?
    In short, you need to enable SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad in the SAP BTP Cockpit and connect them. That means that you need to add both products to your sub account and run the booster, a set of guided, interactive steps that enable you to select, configure, and consume services on SAP BTP. Follow the steps explained in the SAP Discovery Center Mission to Set Up SAP AI Core Generative AI Hub. If you only want to test the Generative AI hub, you can try it now for 30 days. 

    Watch the video to find out more about benchmark engineering and see a demo of prompt optimizer in Generative AI hub.

     

  2. How can I get started with SAP-RPT-1?
    In case you haven‚Äôt heard, SAP has announced its first enterprise relational foundation model (RPT), SAP-RPT-1, along with a no-code testing playground environment. SAP-RPT-1 enables analytical and predictive tasks on structured business data using in-context learning, allowing classification and regression directly via example records in an API call. Grounded in verified enterprise data, it delivers reliable, fact-based predictions without requiring customers to train or manage models. Read more about why this is A New Paradigm for Enterprise AI: In-Context Learning for Relational Data by Dr. Philipp Herzig, Chief Technology Officer at SAP.

    Do you know you can get started with SAP-RPT-1 immediately? There is a web-based testing SAP-RPT playground environment where, at no cost, you can experience the model performance and the model‚Äôs in-context learning capabilities without any coding, utilizing your own data or SAP-provided example datasets. If you want to use your own data, simply upload your CSV or use our sample data files, run real-world scenarios, and see instant insights from your business data with no setup or coding required. Try it now and refer to SAP Help on how to use SAP-RPT-1 via SAP generative AI hub!

    Check out the video to learn more about the latest innovation in SAP Business AI and see SAP-RPT-1 predict a sales price for a house.

     

  3. Could you please share the learning materials to help us learn more and become certified?
    A great starting point is SAP Learning, where you can find an overview of AI-guided learning journeys, documentation, live sessions, and certifications tailored to your preferences.

    Do you know that SAP announced its reimagined certification strategy at this year's SAP TechEd, transitioning from a traditional proctored multiple-choice exam to a comprehensive practical assessment model that reflects real-world work scenarios? Learners can use resources like the SAP Help Portal and AI tools such as SAP Joule for Consultants, just as they would on the job. This shift ensures certifications recognize not only what you know, but how you apply it. To help you prepare for the practical assessment, every learning journey is equipped with a practical exercise to provide hands-on experience.

    To learn more about the content covered in the sessions, the two certifications are a great source of learning: SAP Generative AI Developer or SAP Build Developer (covering Joule Studio). Also, don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to engage with the SAP Business AI Community to learn from and engage with peers.

Want to dive deeper into the content? Rewatch the sessions and access the session material via SAP Learning Hub (subscription required):

  • Build Your Own AI Solution with Generative AI hub (recording)
  • All Things Business AI: Latest Insights, Updates & Live Demos (recording)

Speaking of the latest insights and updates: Have you read the SAP Business AI Release Highlights Q3 2025 and the SAP Innovation Guide H2 2025, which contain all the innovations announced at SAP TechEd? Highlights include:

  • SAP Joule for Consultants: Consultants can now leverage a new Prompt Guide for quick-start tips and a filterable Prompt Library to browse pre-formulated questions by role or area. Watch a demo of the tool here.
  • Generative AI hub: The open-source coding agent Cline has been integrated into generative AI hub. Learn how to prompt, create and innovate with AI Vibe Coding and see the reference architecture for more information.
  • Joule Studio, agent builder beta release enables business and IT users to create custom AI agents that automate complex, end-to-end business processes. Make sure to register to our upcoming Beyond Hype session demonstrating how to build custom Joule agents in Joule Studio.

Hi Joule, where should I get started with the latest learning resources? *

Apart from live enablement sessions, explore our latest on-demand learning resources:

  • Experience SAP Business AI: Discover the business value SAP Business AI delivers across your business with a practical exercise.
  • Find curated learning and enablement resources across the SAP Business AI portfolio from introductory awareness to getting started and deep-dive content, supporting SAP customers in building the knowledge they need to explore, adopt, and succeed with SAP Business AI solutions: SAP Business AI, Joule, Joule Agents, SAP Joule for Consultants, SAP Joule for Developers, Joule Studio, Generative AI hub, SAP Document AI

* Powered by the machine learning technology of SAP AI Business Services, personalized recommendations are generated for employees, in one place on the Learning home page, based on employee data.

As we look ahead into 2026, we‚Äôre excited to share with you a new lineup of learning opportunities designed to help you expand your knowledge and make AI an advantage in your role:

  • January 13, 4 pm CET: Step-by-step guidance to build custom Joule agents in Joule Studio. Understand the exact steps to design and create custom Joule agents.

Stay tuned for more, and happy learning! üöÄ

Further Resources:

  • From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This October
  • From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This November

Joule Joule Studio #generativeaihub #SAPRPT1 #JouleforConsultants #SAPDocumentAI #JouleforDevelopers #AIenablement #AIskills

entry.title: Agent builder in Joule Studio is now generally available: Build your own Joule agents today!
entry.content:
Traditional rule-based automation struggles to keep up with modern business processes, which are constantly evolving and becoming more complex. Agentic AI helps handle dynamic workflows with adaptability. As previewed at TechEd 2025, the agent builder capability in Joule Studio empowers developers to create context-aware Joule agents that can plan, reason, and execute multi-step processes across diverse systems, with self-learning and high adaptability, unlocking new levels of productivity and efficiency across your enterprise. 

Today, building on the release of skill builder in Joule Studio earlier in 2025, we‚Äôre excited to make the agent builder in Joule Studio generally available. The agent builder enables developers to create Joule agents that are tailored to their unique business requirements and break cross-ecosystem silos and reduce barriers to AI adoption. This capability is powered by the same underlying agent framework and runtime that ready-to-use Joule agents do. That offers built-in data protection guardrails, deep reasoning models, and context retention across tasks for scalable, secure multi-agent executions.  

In this post, I‚Äôll take you through what‚Äôs being released as part of the agent builder experience, how to create Joule agents in no time, and resources to help you get started. We‚Äôll explore common use cases to transform business workflows with agentic AI and provide visibility into our roadmap. Together, these insights will help you move from isolated AI experiments to scalable, production-grade agents that deliver real business impact. 

 Key highlights of the release: 

  • AI-guided development: Generate Joule Agents using natural language with vibe coding  
  • Model Context Protocol (MCP) support: Connect to external tools and applications with support for MCP 
  • Multi-agent orchestration: Add subagents as a tool to allow agents to invoke them for planning and executing complex, multi-step workflows 
  • Ground agents in business context: Drive reliable outcomes by grounding agent reasoning in your documents  
  • Leverage your existing SAP Build content: Embed pre-built custom skills, automations, and actions to accelerate time to value  
  • Human in the loop: ensure human oversight for critical decisions and approvals 

"With Joule Studio, agentic innovation moves closer to the heart of operations. At KPMG, we‚Äôre helping to shape trusted solutions that transform business context into measurable value by building specialized AI agents for fulfillment orchestration, supply chain management, and more‚Äù.  

 - Valentino K√∂ster, Global Head of SAP360 Program & AI, KPMG AG WPG, Germany 

 

Meet Agent builder - the next evolution for Joule Studio  

Joule Studio is a capability in SAP Build that allows developers to design Joule agents and skills with a low code, no code canvas. Since it is part of SAP Build, Joule Studio has native access to all your connectors, automations, apps, and actions - enabling you to reuse artifacts, leverage shared APIs, and operate within a single governance framework. The agents created in Joule Studio work across their on-prem solutions including S/4 HANA and SAP ECC, SAP Cloud solutions, and third-party APIs and applications. Joule Studio leverages SAP Cloud Identity Services so that your agents have the right authorization and authentication for tasks that they are supposed to complete. It also enforces principal propagation, meaning the user‚Äôs identity in Joule is passed through end-to-end so that any triggered skill or agent runs strictly within that user‚Äôs security context, applying the same authorization checks and access restrictions. Moreover, it is integrated with Joule and AI core to seamlessly expose custom agents through Joule, empower agents with deep reasoning through models, and ground them in business data with document grounding.  

Image 1: Joule Studio Marketecture

 

Now let's dive into key features of agent builder in Joule Studio that simplifies the creation of powerful agents.

AI-guided development experience to fast-track deployment of AI agents 

Joule Studio brings AI guidance directly into the agent builder experience. Developers can describe what they need in plain language, and the Joule copilot responds with tailored suggestions for agent definitions, tools, and configuration options.  For instance, when building a logistics-focused agent, Joule may recommend a relevant Joule skill to fetch real-time stock levels and low-stock thresholds. This bridges the gap between simplicity and flexibility - empowering teams to innovate faster while maintaining full control over agent behavior.   

 

Image 2: AI-guided development for building agents in Joule Studio

 

Support for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for enhanced interoperability  

A major enhancement in Joule Studio is the newly added support for MCP - an open, standardized protocol that streamlines how AI agents interact with external systems. Instead of working within isolated applications, agents can now operate seamlessly across different platforms. 

In Joule Studio, you can connect agents to external MCP servers via destinations, configured in BTP Cockpit. That enables custom agents to tap into tools and services outside the SAP ecosystem. For instance, a support agent built in Joule Studio can create or update purchase requests in an external purchase requisition tool that exposes its capabilities via MCP. This level of interoperability turns AI agents into intelligent orchestrators that can handle end-to-end workflows across multiple systems without requiring custom integrations or heavy engineering effort. 

 

Image 3: Connecting custom Joule agents with third-party tools and applications using MCP

 

Creating multi-agent systems for complex workflows 

Joule Studio enables developers to build a modular ‚ÄúAI workforce‚Äù by allowing agents to be added as callable tools within other agents. Each agent can delegate tasks to specialized sub-agents built in Joule Studio and collaborate to solve much larger or more complex problems. This orchestration modularity avoids relying on a single, monolithic agent to handle everything and ensures clearer separation of responsibilities, simplifies testing and maintenance, and makes it far easier to scale agentic solutions as business needs evolve. 

For example, an ‚ÄúInventory Restocking Agent‚Äù can act as an orchestrator and delegate tasks to specialized sub-agents such as a ‚ÄúContract Compliance Checker‚Äù to validate that each proposed restocking order aligns with supplier contract terms before it is placed. These specialized sub-agents are built with Joule Studio and serve as reusable resources for other agents.  

Image 4: Adding other custom Joule agents built in Joule Studio as tools for other Joule agents 

From an idea to an agent in few simple steps 

Joule agents solve complex business challenges dynamically and intelligently. They excel in planning, reasoning, and autonomous execution, seamlessly navigating unknown paths with informed decision-making. Following are the key components of the agent definition:  

Goals and instructions: these act as job description for the agent and helps it understand its role and responsibilities  

Planning and reasoning: Large Language Models (LLMs) help agents plan and reason through the complex scenario   

Execution: agents need tools to interact with their environment and execute. 

Agent builder in Joule Studio allows designing a Joule agent with all the needed components in a low code/no code canvas that empowers both professional and citizen developers, allowing for scalability, governance, and alignment with SAP‚Äôs clean-core principles. 

The core steps include: 

  • Create a Project in SAP Build: Access SAP Build lobby and select project type for Joule Studio: ‚ÄòJoule agent and skill‚Äô. After filling out meta data for Joule Studio project, within that, create AI Agent as an artifact. 
  • Add Metadata: Assign name and description for the agent. This meta data helps Joule to identify the right agent for the job based on user intent. 
  • Define expertise and instructions: these provide the agent with context on its role and guide the agent‚Äôs behavior and decision-making. 
  • Configure tools: Select and configure the tools the agent can use to execute:  
  • MCP Servers: connect agents to external tools and applications exposed via MCP server, using destinations configured in BTP Cockpit. 
  • Sub agents as a tool: add other custom agents designed in Joule Studio as tools for one another, defining multi-agent systems for complex workflows. 
  • Joule skills: for executing rule-based, deterministic tasks 
  • Document grounding: create resource groups in AI Core with your business documents, then add those resource groups as tools to your agent in Joule Studio. This grounds agents in business context needed for a workflow. For example, adding carrier contracts to a logistic agent for making informed decisions on carriers for optimizing shipment transport. 
  • Human in the Loop: human oversight is ensured by default for critical decisions and compliance. 
  • Calculator: for mathematical calculations 
  • Testing: debug the agent in Joule Studio before deployment to see each step of its reasoning, actions and data flow, using mock conversations, tool-call scenarios and edge cases. 
  • Release and deploy: Once validated, deploy the agent into the designated environment, making it accessible to authorized users via Joule or other configured channels. 

This modular approach not only accelerates development but also embeds governance controls - such as tool usage boundaries and human-in-the-loop checkpoints - directly into the design process, ensuring enterprise-grade reliability and flexibility. See the demo below: 

 

‚ÄúWith Joule Studio, we could build powerful agents in three weeks. It is an intuitive, no‚Äëcode environment that enables system connectivity across SAP and non‚ÄëSAP critical environments, for a hybrid landscapes where data resides in multiple modules.‚Äù  

 - Gianluca Simeone, VP - Global SAP CTIO and Gen-AI Leader at Capgemini 

Use cases for custom Joule agents 

Joule agents are ideal for solving complex, dynamic problems that traditional automation come short in solving. They excel in scenarios where planning, reasoning, and adaptive execution are critical. Let‚Äôs explore some of common use cases for creating custom Joule agents: 

  • Payroll variance analysis: An agent can simplify payroll variance analysis, a critical process for financial control and compliance, by instantly determining the source of variances, confirming allowances align with company policies, andreducing resolution time. This provides managers and payroll specialists with visibility into deviations, ensuring accuracy and confidence in payroll operations. Read more. 
  • Customer purchasing behavior analysis: An agent can help sales representatives quickly identify anomalies in customer purchasing behavior and assist in responding proactively to improve customer experience. Read more 
  • Inventory management: An agent can enable manufacturers and retailers to reduce losses from aging and obsolete inventory by turning inventory management into a proactive, data-driven process. For example, an agent can scan SAP S/4HANA data to detect early signs of obsolescence, categorize risk, and suggest actions such as redistribution or markdowns. Read more. 
  • Q&A: An agent can interpret complex queries by retrieving accurate information instantly from enterprise systems, documents, and knowledge bases to surface the most relevant insights, and guide users step-by-step through processes. This reduces the dependency on manual lookups and helps users get the right answers quickly and consistently. Read more. 
  • Logistics: An agent can optimize delivery routes based on real-time traffic data, weather conditions, and carrier availability, enhancing efficiency and reducing transportation costs.  

‚ÄúNestle, SAP, and IBM worked together on a supply chain Agentic AI PoC. With the agent builder capability in Joule Studio, we created this POC bringing in data from SAP and non-SAP sources to create an agent that will automate our complex Order fulfillment processes‚Äù   

- Pablo Nill, Sr Product Group Manager, Nestle     

Image 5: Concept of a custom AI agent created to optimize logistics of a shipment

 

Looking ahead 

This is only the beginning. We‚Äôre working on bringing following new capabilities in the agent builder next year as part of our roadmap: 

  •  System-Triggered Agents: Enable agents to activate automatically based on system events, API triggers or schedule reducing manual intervention and accelerating workflows. 
  • Agent-to-Agent Collaboration (A2A): Allow agents to collaborate with third-party agents, coordinating tasks and sharing context for complex, multi-step processes. 
  • Agent Extensibility: Adapt ready-to-use Joule agents by adding tools and pre- and post-processing logic in an upgrade-safe way, ensuring flexibility without compromising stability. 

We‚Äôre running a limited-time promotion that lets your agents run at no cost until end of Jan 2026. Don't miss out on this opportunity and see following resources to help you get started: 

  • How to Get Started with Joule Studio 
  • Learn how to activate Joule Studio 
  • Joule Studio Goes Live: Answers to Your Top Questions 
  • Customer testimonial (Uniper) 
  • Watch the on-demand webinar for a deeper dive in agent builder 
  • Podcast 

Meanwhile, if you have any questions, contact our product experts: @Kvidit , @maria_kondratyeva , @soufia , @jenie , @shamichi , @eric_solberg , and @noravonthenen.

entry.title: Part 2: Building the Intelligent Maintenance Fulfillment Agent in Joule Studio
entry.content:
In my previous blog post, we laid the groundwork by creating, configuring, and deploying individual Joule Skills  (GetMaintenanceOrderDetails, GetOperationComponents, GetMaterialStockLevels, etc.) . These skills allow Joule to "talk" to our backend and perform specific tasks like fetching maintenance order details or checking material stock levels.However, a maintenance planner doesn't just want raw data; they want answers to complex questions like, "Can I finish this job today based on what's in the warehouse?" In this post, we move beyond individual skills. We will build a Joule Agent- the "brain" that orchestrates those skills to provide intelligent, end-to-end validation. 

Step 7: Create the Joule Agent Project 

  1. Go to your Joule Skill Project > Overview tab 
  2. Click Create > Joule Agent. 
  3. Fill in the following: 
    • Name: e.g., Maintenance Fulfillment Validator 
    • Identifier: maintenanceFulfillmentValidator 
    • Description: e.g., Agent to check if maintenance orders can proceed based on material stock levels .
  4. Click Create

Step 8: Add Expertise & Instructions 

After creation, you‚Äôll land on the agent editor screen: 

Add a clear Expertise Summary to describe what your agent is good at (e.g., "Validating maintenance order fulfillment based on stock availability") 

In the Instructions section, define how the agent should behave: 

Step 9: Configure Model Settings & Tools 

Scroll down to the Model Settings section: 

  1. Choose your LLM Provider (e.g., SAP Joule Model or other available models) 
  2. Click Add Tool.

     

  3.  From the dropdown, select Joule Skill.
  4. You will now see a list of all the skills created in your project 
  5. Add all the relevant skills for your use case: 
    • GetMaintenanceOrderDetails 
    • GetOrderOperations 
    • GetOperationComponents 
    • GetMaterialDetails 
    • GetMaterialStockLevels 

 

Alternative Approach: Using Vibe Coding

Joule Studio offers an innovative capability called vibe coding that allows developers to define agents using natural language rather than manually wiring every step.

Instead of explicitly defining the orchestration logic, you describe the agent's goal, available skills, and constraints‚Äîand Joule Studio generates the agent flow for you. This makes vibe coding particularly useful for rapid prototyping, experimentation, and learning how agents reason across multiple skills.

In this section, we will recreate the same stock validation agent built earlier, but this time using vibe coding, to demonstrate how quickly an end-to-end agent can be assembled once the fundamentals are understood. 

Step 10: The "Vibe Coding" Alternative ‚Äì Speed to Market 

  1. Open the Assistant: Click the Joule Chat icon inside the Agent Editor. 

     

  2. Prompt the Vibe:  "Create an agent that is able to validate maintenance orders, check material stock, and recommend actions to ensure fulfillment. 
    Include all available skills and use all the information you have (from the description and skills) to formulate expertise, fully describe the process in instructions and additional context.‚Äù 

     

  3. Confirm Generation: Joule generates the Instructions and Expertise automatically. It also suggests linking the Skills we built in Part 1. 
    1. Open the newly created agent in your project. 
    2. Review the Instructions and Expertise sections to confirm that Joule has generated a detailed, end-to-end logic for maintenance order validation. 
  4. Verify that the previously created skills are automatically added as Tools for the agent. 

     

  5. Refining the Vibe (Continuous Improvement): The true power of vibe coding is that you can iteratively add or refine your prompt based on what changes you need in your agent.
    1.  Iterative Improvement Example: Return to the Joule Chat assistant and provide additional refinement prompts: 
    2. Prompt 2 (Enhanced Instructions): "Update the current instructions of the Maintenance Fulfillment Agent to be highly detailed in each step. This includes requesting the order ID if not given, then extracting all information about the order including its operations. For each operation the components shall be extracted and verified by analyzing stock levels and details like open purchase orders, blocks etc. A fulfillment decision should be made depending on the analysis with a full explanation." 
    3. Review the Updates:Observe how Joule automatically updates the Instructions section with more granular step-by-step logic.

Step 11: Configure Skill Access Settings 

Regardless of whether you created your agent manually or through vibe coding, you need to configure how skills can be accessed: 

Important Configuration: 

  1. Navigate to each skill that your agent uses as a tool 
  2. Locate the toggle "Allow skill to be started directly by a user" 
  3. Ensure this toggle is turned OFF for all skills used by your agent 
  4. This configuration: 
    • Allows the agent to call skills programmatically 
    • Prevents direct user access to individual skills 
  5. Ensures users interact with the intelligent agent rather than raw skill outputs. 

     

Step 12: Test Your Agent (Before Deployment) 

Before deploying your agent to production, Joule Studio provides a built-in testing feature that allows you to validate your agent's functionality without deployment: 

  1. In the Agent Editor, locate the Test panel or Test button 

     

  2. Select your private environment which you can create in Environment in the control panel. 
  3. Click continue.

This opens an interactive testing interface within Joule Studio where you can ask your question to the agent.

Once you start testing your agent, you can observe how it intelligently orchestrates multiple skills to fulfill complex requests.

 

Example Prompts to Test the Agent 

  1. ‚ÄúCan order 25 be fulfilled with current stock?‚Äù 
  2. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs blocking maintenance order 20?‚Äù 
  3. ‚ÄúIs order 1 ready to proceed or does it need follow-up?‚Äù 
  4. ‚ÄúWhy is order 4 still pending?‚Äù 
  5. ‚ÄúWhich materials are causing delays in maintenance order 24?‚Äù 
  6. ‚ÄúIs material M-45678 available in stock?‚Äù 
  7. ‚ÄúHow much of material M-98765 do we have?‚Äù 
  8. ‚ÄúDo we have enough materials for order with ID 10?‚Äù 

 

Step 13: Release, Version, and Deploy the Agent 

The deployment process for Joule Agents follows the same workflow as deploying Joule Skills. 

For detailed deployment steps, refer to "Step 6: Release and Deploy Joule Skills" from my previous blog post: How to Build Stock Validation Skills in Joule Studio 

Quick Summary: 

  1. Release: Click Release to version your agent 
  2. Navigate: Go to Project > Versions 
  3. Deploy: Click Deploy 
  4. Configure Deployment: 
    1. Select your Environment: Use the environment you created in Step 2 of the previous blog post 
    2. Select your Destination: Choose the appropriate destination 
    3. Ensure the destination is associated with your chosen environment 
  5. Confirm: Click Deploy 

The "Last Mile": Moving your Agent to Production 

Once your agent is Active, you‚Äôll want to see it in action within the actual Joule Chat experience (e.g., in the BTP Cockpit or an SAP LoB application). To "productionize" your agent, follow these critical configuration steps: 

  1. Check your Formation: Ensure your BTP Formation is configured correctly in the BTP Cockpit and includes the necessary SAP LoB Application. 
  2. Enable Joule Shared: In the SAP Build app, navigate to the Environment level > Joule Tab. Under settings, enable Share Environment Capabilities. This allows the agent to be "seen" by the broader Joule tenant. 

     

  3. The Sync Window: After deploying to a shared environment, it typically takes about 30 minutes for the background synchronization to complete. 

Step 16: Advanced Integration - MCP Servers (Optional) 

For enterprise scenarios requiring external system integration beyond SAP, Joule Studio supports Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers as additional tools for your agent. 

What MCP Servers Enable: 

  • Connect to external APIs and third-party services 
  • Integrate with non-SAP databases and systems 
  • Build cross-system orchestration workflows 
  • Extend agent capabilities beyond SAP ecosystem 

High-Level Setup Process: 

  1. BTP Configuration: Create and configure MCP server destinations in your BTP Cockpit 
  2. Joule Studio Integration: Add the configured destinations to your Joule Studio environment 
  3. Agent Integration: Reference MCP servers in your agent alongside Joule Skills 

Wrapping Up Part 2: From Skills to Intelligent Orchestration 

In this second part of our Joule Studio blog , we've elevated individual skills into an intelligent agent that can orchestrate multiple capabilities seamlessly. Your Maintenance Fulfillment Validator agent now understands complex maintenance scenarios, coordinates between different skills, and provides comprehensive responses about order fulfillment and stock validation. 

Key Achievements: 

  • Traditional Agent Building: Step-by-step manual configuration of expertise, instructions, and skill orchestration 
  • Vibe Coding Innovation: Rapid agent creation using natural language prompts - demonstrating how Joule Studio can automatically generate agent logic, expertise, and instructions 
  • Multi-Skill Orchestration: Your agent intelligently coordinates multiple skills to provide holistic business insights 

Vibe Coding Advantage: The introduction of vibe coding shows how Joule Studio is evolving to accelerate development cycles. What traditionally required manual configuration can now be achieved through conversational AI, making agent development more accessible and faster. 

With both individual skills, intelligent agents, and rapid prototyping capabilities in your toolkit, you're now equipped to build sophisticated automation solutions that can handle complex business scenarios with human-like intelligence. 

Looking Ahead: The Future of Joule Studio Agents 

As Joule Studio continues to evolve, exciting capabilities are on the roadmap that will further transform how businesses leverage AI automation: 

  • Agent-to-Agent (A2A) Communication: Enabling agents to collaborate and coordinate with each other for complex multi-domain workflows 
  • Agent Extensibility: Advanced customization capabilities allowing deeper integration with your specific business processes 
  • System-Triggered Agents: Proactive agents that respond automatically to business events and system triggers, moving beyond user-initiated interactions 

The foundation you've built today positions you perfectly to leverage these advanced capabilities as they become available, creating even more sophisticated and autonomous business solutions.

  • Setting Up Joule Studio for All Customer Flows and Entitlement Levels
  • Joule Studio Goes Live: Answers to Your Top Questions 
  • Customer testimonial (Uniper) 
  • Watch the on-demand webinar for a deeper dive in agent builder
